commit_message:
Manage/unmanage impl for NetApp ONTAP iscsi driver

This patch implements manage and unmanage support for NetApp's
cmode and 7mode iscsi drivers. The input required for manage call
is either source-id or source-name or both.

Implements: Blueprint cdot-iscsi-manage-unmanage
Implements: Blueprint 7mode-iscsi-manage-unmanage

Change-Id: Ifdc700122b98a2fb6cbd53d913d72391d7e92b54

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-02-21 17:43:19.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/api/middleware/test_context.py', 'barbican/api/middleware/context.py'], 'message': 'Fixing unable to retrieve req id bug

generate an id in the format expected by openstack services

Context:
The original code in BaseContextMiddleware was copied from Glance
at the beginning of the project, but it has never worked because
we don't build our requests and responses like Glance does. As
a result, the old code has been logging a "Unabled to retrieve request
id from context" warning for every response. This change properly
retrieves the id (if there), or generates one if needed.

Closes-Bug: 1424221
Change-Id: I7e22474775de3c3f33968144d098bedbfc462e7a
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fixing unable to retrieve req id bug

Properly returning the id if it was provided on the request. If not,
generate an id in the format expected by openstack services
and clients.

Context:
The original code in BaseContextMiddleware was copied from Glance
at the beginning of the project, but it has never worked because
we don't build our requests and responses like Glance does. As
a result, the old code has been logging a "Unabled to retrieve request
id from context" warning for every response. This change properly
retrieves the id (if there), or generates one if needed.

Closes-Bug: 1424221
Change-Id: I7e22474775de3c3f33968144d098bedbfc462e7a

commit_message:
Add a devstack-gate job to barbicanclient's tests

Add a devstack-gate job to python-barbicanclient's tests.  Initially the
gate job will be non-voting so that any issues found can be fixed.

Change-Id: Icf2b22262a9c2f59ab1722107e028da6b1829f6a

commit_message:
Fix to allow for arbitrary interface naming

Previously facter parameters ipaddress_eth0 and ipaddress_eth1 were
hardcoded at various places in the tests. RHEL 7, CentOS 7, Fedora 21
and similar are using systemd's predictable naming instead which in
vagrant/virtualbox leads to things like ipaddress_enp0s3 or
ipaddress_enp0s8 instead and consequently breaks testing on those
systems.

Change-Id: I0a045c673e218d6a611dc9f4e2f187b7e33eb143

commit_message:
Sync 'eventlet_backdoor' module from oslo-incubator

The eventlet_backdor module hasn't been updated in Cinder since
September of 2014.  In order to be able to move to the oslo.log
library and be able o clean other modules out of oslo-incubator
we need to bring it up to the latest level.

Current HEAD in OSLO:
---------------------
commit e589dde0721a0a67e4030813e582afec6e70d042
Date:  Wed Feb 18 03:08:12 2015 +0000
Merge "Have a little fun with release notes"

Changes merged with this patch:
---------------------
2aacb111 - Change oslo.config to oslo_config
2fbf5065 - Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API
80c47519 - Remove unnecessary import of eventlet
a3220c51 - add list_opts to all modules with configuration options
5d40e143 - Remove code that moved to oslo.i18n

Change-Id: I875964a00e449e2314a648cc9586d97e51990de8

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-19 22:09:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Adding file discovery and directory exclusion

Bandit has relied on piping the find command to build the test
bed.  This change introduces file discovery capabilities to Bandit,
along with the capability to exclude directories and specify which
file extensions should be scanned.

Excluded directories and file extensions are specified in the
config file.  This change also introduces a '-r' flag which
indicates that Bandit should discover files recursively in a
directory.

Change-Id: I642b7fcbfd678a68d0219e35b565b03928b437e4

commit_message:
Adding file discovery and directory exclusion

Bandit has relied on piping the find command to build the test
bed.  This change introduces file discovery capabilities to Bandit,
along with the capability to exclude directories and specify which
file extensions should be scanned.

Excluded directories and file extensions are specified in the
config file.  This change also introduces a '-r' flag which
indicates that Bandit should discover files recursively in a
directory.

Change-Id: I642b7fcbfd678a68d0219e35b565b03928b437e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-15 20:04:51.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/contrib/ec2/controllers.py'], 'message': 'Distinguish between missing access/signature ec2 creds 401 errors

A couple of tempest tests fail with boto >= 2.35.1 and we're seeing
"EC2 signature not supplied" in the keystone logs but there is no
stacktrace and nova already has it's own checks for the access and
signature in the request, so something is going wrong here but when the
error message in keystone is the same for missing access and signature
in the credentials it makes it hard to debug where we're failing, so
this makes the access error message slightly different.

Related-Bug: #1410622

Change-Id: Ib150b12468eab6edb0fe624de83edbbc61e6b694
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Distinguish between missing access/signature ec2 creds 401 errors

A couple of tempest tests fail with boto >= 2.35.1 and we're seeing
"EC2 signature not supplied" in the keystone logs but there is no
stacktrace and nova already has it's own checks for the access and
signature in the request, so something is going wrong here but when the
error message in keystone is the same for missing access and signature
in the credentials it makes it hard to debug where we're failing, so
this makes the access error message slightly different.

Related-Bug: #1410622

Change-Id: Ib150b12468eab6edb0fe624de83edbbc61e6b694

commit_message:
Add Barbican order metadata table and repository

Barbican Order Metadata table is needed to store data that is
needed to process orders, but not found in the original request.
This adds the database tables and repo for this data.

Change-Id: I518db1993da186608e537cfef2b8befb678b54f4

commit_message:
Add paraVirtual into vmware_adaptertype related descriptions

There are two places related to vmware_adaptertype. One is in
http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/content/chapter_cli-glance-property.html,
which has document this new added adapter type, another is in
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/vmware.html,
which will add this type in the related section by this fix.

Verified in local generated html/pdf files

Change-Id: Ibd59d8f3a10b25209de40400ebdadc48a2d86105
Closes-Bug: #1373973

commit_message:
Add list-stack-with-resources scenario

Added scenario that allows to test list_resources(stack) command
in Heat. In addition, added samples and unittest for the scenario.

Change-Id: I05c8dd12807756d35191a79820f3ff9ec0ab35ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-18 22:09:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable tempest scenarios for aio

This patch updates the tempest resources play to create all the
pre-requistes for running the commit_aio tempest tests.  This is
currently test_minimum_basic and test_swift_basic_ops.
Also defaults gate-check-commit RUN_TEMPEST and DEPLOY_TEMPEST variables
to yes.

Several other improvements were required to get tempest to run.
* The AIO interfaces file was changed to allow for proper networking of
  a flat network within an environment.
* ml2_conf.ini a variable was added to override an assumed network
  interface on a physical host.
* rpc_tempest_gate.sh was updated to allow for commit_aio testing.
* The gate scripts were update to support running tempest. in the
  environment.

Conflicts:
        rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/tempest_all.yml
        rpc_deployment/library/neutron
        rpc_deployment/roles/tempest/files/rpc_tempest_gate.sh
        rpc_deployment/roles/tempest/templates/tempest.conf.j2
        rpc_deployment/roles/tempest_resources/tasks/main.yml
        scripts/gate-check-commit.sh
        rpc_deployment/roles/tempest/files/rpc_tempest_gate.sh

Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders <hugh@wherenow.org>
Closes-Bug: #1419094
Change-Id: Ib92b30f040cf05202d7785c8a3132150d31ef92e

commit_message:
Enable tempest scenarios for aio

This patch updates the tempest resources play to create all the
pre-requistes for running the commit_aio tempest tests.  This is
currently test_minimum_basic and test_swift_basic_ops.
Also defaults gate-check-commit RUN_TEMPEST and DEPLOY_TEMPEST variables
to yes.

Several other improvements were required to get tempest to run.
* The AIO interfaces file was changed to allow for proper networking of
  a flat network within an environment.
* ml2_conf.ini a variable was added to override an assumed network
  interface on a physical host.
* rpc_tempest_gate.sh was updated to allow for commit_aio testing.
* The gate scripts were update to support running tempest. in the
  environment.

Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders <hugh@wherenow.org>
Closes-Bug: #1419094

Conflicts:
        rpc_deployment/roles/tempest/templates/tempest.conf.j2
        scripts/gate-check-commit.sh

Change-Id: Ib92b30f040cf05202d7785c8a3132150d31ef92e
(cherry picked from commit b5c11f23f649a461253a9643be4b2720b72c2393)

commit_message:
Add Manila project (Shared file systems service)

Manila is OpenStack Shared file systems service.
It consists of 3 main parts:
- m-api (API service)
- m-shr (Share service)
- m-sch (Scheduler service)

To enabled it, just add "manila,m-api,m-shr,m-sch" to enabled services.
Default backend driver (Generic) of Manila depends on Nova, Cinder and Neutron
services. So, using devstack, Manila should be installed after mentioned
projects.

Implements BP manila-project-support
Change-Id: Iab8d4ee0919672a41dee7c7ce56a25799bdac809

[{'created': '2015-02-05 19:43:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Include launch_command.py in MANIFEST.in

The file launch_command.py was missed in the MANIFEST.in for Juno,
which results in a non-functional Spark cluster.

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1184522 for one
expression of this bug.

The change to fix this bug was rolled into this review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/146659/13
It is not appropriate for cherry-picking, as the change with
which it was made is much larger, but nonetheless this issue does
render Spark clusters inoperable in Juno. The change is approved
in master. Please let me know if a more formal process of
registering the bug and attempting to create an atomic commit is
needed; it seemed to me that given the state of this issue,
attempting to do so might only create a more tangled web, but I'm
happy to do so if it is preferable.

Change-Id: I29a17eb3ae9f9a3b8c5412d0be1813cfeca99622

commit_message:
Include launch_command.py in MANIFEST.in

The file launch_command.py was missed in the MANIFEST.in for Juno,
which results in a non-functional Spark cluster.

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1184522 for one
expression of this bug.

The change to fix this bug was rolled into this review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/146659/13
It is not appropriate for cherry-picking, as the change with
which it was made is much larger, but nonetheless this issue does
render Spark clusters inoperable in Juno. The change is approved
in master. Please let me know if a more formal process of
registering the bug and attempting to create an atomic commit is
needed; it seemed to me that given the state of this issue,
attempting to do so might only create a more tangled web, but I'm
happy to do so if it is preferable.

Closes-bug: #1419868
Change-Id: I29a17eb3ae9f9a3b8c5412d0be1813cfeca99622

commit_message:
Reworked filters section to highlight security details.

Specific Changes:
* Touched up second paragraph to ensure focus is on security.
* Removed summary of the small subset of filters.
* Broke down current list into four main categories.
* Described the behavior of those four categories.
* Moved weights illustration down.
* Listed possible specific issues with filter sets.
* Cleaning up for Jenkins and removing itemizedlist and listitem
* Changing wording for clarity and readability.

Change-Id: I250762d73a2b7f4a84ad7f49da6b59d6f918d330
Closes-Bug: #1344291

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-20 14:33:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': "Improve exception handling in _process_router_update()

in _process_router_update() where _process_router_if_compatible()
method is called only RouterNotCompatibleWithAgent exception is handled.
In case any other (intermittent) exception happens inside
_process_router_if_compatible() (e.g. MessagingTimeout on fetching
external net from server) it results in a situation where agent completely
forgets about the router and continues working as usual while server
shows router hosted by agent.

This patch adds handler for broader exception there and set
fullsync = True like it's done earlier in _process_router_update()
when getting routers from server.

Change-Id: I5bfc540a926349848702100744f97c597b852604
Closes-Bug: #1423571
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Improve exception handling in _process_router_update()

in _process_router_update() where _process_router_if_compatible()
method is called only RouterNotCompatibleWithAgent exception is handled.
In case any other (intermittent) exception happens inside
_process_router_if_compatible() (e.g. MessagingTimeout on fetching
external net from server) it results in a situation where agent completely
forgets about the router and continues working as usual while server
shows router hosted by agent.

This patch adds handler for broader exception there and set
fullsync = True like it's done earlier in _process_router_update()
when getting routers from server.

Change-Id: I5bfc540a926349848702100744f97c597b852604
Closes-Bug: #1423571

commit_message:
Use the enum library for the retry strategy enumerations

Instead of having a set of string constants that are the
retry strategy/decision result have it instead be an enumerator
that can be more clearly associated in docs and in code that
these values are explicitly the strategies that the retry
code can use (making it more obvious to users of these constants
what they are for).

This also updates the retry docs to use this new linkable
class when describing the various strategies that can be
used/returned.

Change-Id: I944e521562be26f5315d7553da8d5820fc284c49

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-20 14:56:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/ra.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/interface.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_linux_interface.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': "WIP: Support multiple IPv6 prefixes on internal router ports

(Patch set #3 for the multiple-ipv6-prefixes blueprint)

WIP - Needs unit tests!

Provides support for adding multiple IPv6 subnets to an internal router port.
The limitation of one IPv4 subnet per internal router port remains,
though a port may contain one IPv4 subnet with any number of IPv6
subnets.

This changes the behavior of both the router-interface-add and
router-interface-delete APIs. When router-interface-add is called with an
IPv6 subnet, the subnet will be added to an existing internal port on the
router with the same network ID if the existing port already has one or
more IPv6 subnets. Otherwise, a new port will be created on the router
for that subnet. When calling the router-interface-add with a port (one
that has already been created using the port-create command), that port
will be added to the router if it meets the following conditions:

        1. The port has no more than one IPv4 subnet.
        2. If the port has any IPv6 subnets, it must not have the same
           network ID as an existing port on the router if the existing
           port has any IPv6 subnets.

If the router-interface-delete command is called with a subnet, that
subnet will be removed from the router port to which it belongs. If the
subnet is the last subnet on a port, the port itself will be deleted
from the router. If the router-interface-delete command is called with a
port, that port will be deleted from the router.

This change also allows the RADVD configuration to support advertising multiple
prefixes on a single router interface.

This patchset does not include the following work items for the
'multiple-ipv6-prefixes' blueprint:
- Port-create API handling changes (proposed in earlier patchset)
- Port-update API handling changes (proposed in earlier patchset)
- Dual-stack external gateway ports (proposed in earlier patchset)
- Subnet create changes (TBD soon)

Change-Id: I7d4e8194815e626f1cfa267f77a3f2475fdfa3d1
Partially-implements: blueprint multiple-ipv6-prefixes

Change-Id: I5552e6477e7656c7c82d50a6466c517d239cb380
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
WIP: Support multiple IPv6 prefixes on internal router ports

(Patch set #3 for the multiple-ipv6-prefixes blueprint)

WIP - Needs unit tests!

Provides support for adding multiple IPv6 subnets to an internal router port.
The limitation of one IPv4 subnet per internal router port remains,
though a port may contain one IPv4 subnet with any number of IPv6
subnets.

This changes the behavior of both the router-interface-add and
router-interface-delete APIs. When router-interface-add is called with an
IPv6 subnet, the subnet will be added to an existing internal port on the
router with the same network ID if the existing port already has one or
more IPv6 subnets. Otherwise, a new port will be created on the router
for that subnet. When calling the router-interface-add with a port (one
that has already been created using the port-create command), that port
will be added to the router if it meets the following conditions:

        1. The port has no more than one IPv4 subnet.
        2. If the port has any IPv6 subnets, it must not have the same
           network ID as an existing port on the router if the existing
           port has any IPv6 subnets.

If the router-interface-delete command is called with a subnet, that
subnet will be removed from the router port to which it belongs. If the
subnet is the last subnet on a port, the port itself will be deleted
from the router. If the router-interface-delete command is called with a
port, that port will be deleted from the router.

This change also allows the RADVD configuration to support advertising multiple
prefixes on a single router interface.

This patchset does not include the following work items for the
'multiple-ipv6-prefixes' blueprint:
- Port-create API handling changes (proposed in earlier patchset)
- Port-update API handling changes (proposed in earlier patchset)
- Dual-stack external gateway ports (proposed in earlier patchset)
- Subnet create changes (TBD soon)

Change-Id: I7d4e8194815e626f1cfa267f77a3f2475fdfa3d1
Partially-implements: blueprint multiple-ipv6-prefixes

Change-Id: I5552e6477e7656c7c82d50a6466c517d239cb380

commit_message:
Network Rest API for Angular Front End

This is the API which abstracts Nova vs Neutron calls
for the angular front end.

This initial patch will only implement the APIs needed to
support the launch instance work.

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign

Change-Id: I6967fbae472e6aa944994d94ab327c4fb594b1d0

commit_message:
Log exception on tear_down failure

Give the operator better insight as to why the tear down actually
failed. Also use node instead of task.node while we're in there.

Change-Id: I704e89a4711dcef225e96394976d11b94a1825ff

commit_message:
makes router id visible in update router modal

In update router modal, the router id textinput
is hidden. since duplicate router name is allowed,
it is difficult to differentiate.

This patch is making the router id field visible
and readonly.

Change-Id: I898bdc7a92b011ce61ab0375e04d81d82a83a313
Closes-Bug: #1421589

commit_message:
Refactor filter and sensitivity tests in prepartion for LDAP support

Some aspects of the tests aren't suitable for an LDAP backend,
so make them more generic - without reducing test coverage.

Partially implements: blueprint ldap-filtering

Change-Id: Ifd67a9d2879e3cc2ac24cb0536ecbd613ee85049

subject: Make Resource.find more general purpose
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-15 01:45:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make Resource.find more general purpose

Different services have different levels of support for filtering during
requests, so there isn't one catch-all method that can work while using
URL query parameters. For example, some services expect "filters" while
others expect "filter", and several offer different support beyond that.

As a base class, the most common way to make this work is to get all of
the values for the given resource and then do our own filtering, which
this change implements via the `filter` builtin. While this won't be the
most efficient method by any means, it's general purpose enough to work
as a base class. For services that do support filtering, their resources
can override the `find` method to provide their more specific
functionality.

Change-Id: Ic23320e31b7c4d129aed6cf4d1e5648164b85a73
Related-Bug: 1384230
Related-Bug: 1419576

commit_message:
Make Resource.find more general purpose

Different services have different levels of support for filtering during
requests, so there isn't one catch-all method that can work while using
URL query parameters. For example, some services expect "filters" while
others expect "filter", and several offer different support beyond that.

As a base class, the most common way to make this work is to get all of
the values for the given resource and then do our own filtering, which
this change implements via the `filter` builtin. While this won't be the
most efficient method by any means, it's general purpose enough to work
as a base class. For services that do support filtering, their resources
can override the `find` method to provide their more specific
functionality.

Change-Id: Ic23320e31b7c4d129aed6cf4d1e5648164b85a73
Related-Bug: 1384230
Related-Bug: 1419576

commit_message:
Document compute/v2 resources

This change adds documentation to be picked up by autodoc for resources
under the compute/v2 namespace. LimitsAbsolute isn't in there because
it's part of another change, but doesn't need to be dependent here.

Change-Id: I262bf985de041160d5ceaf7b2b21e3b726c6cf9f

commit_message:
Cisco Nexus ML2 Vendor decomposition

This adds a thin shim replacing the Cisco Nexus mech driver so that it
may use the code now stored in the networking-cisco stackforge. The code
for this driver that has been moved into the stackforge is also removed by
this patch.

Partial-Implements: blueprint core-vendor-decomposition
Change-Id: Ib88fd121509e96be42fb0bd22422ccaa7d4eb0f1
Closes-Bug: 1419010

subject: Add the Type resource for the Volume service
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-12 00:05:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add the Type resource for the Volume service

This change also enables documentation to start showing up for Volume
resources

Change-Id: I3193f973a5c0ad00c2bebe477a8748fc7a7d7a5f
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-02-12 04:13:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add the Type resource for the Volume service

This change also enables documentation to start showing up for Volume
resources.

A specialization of Type.list is now provided because a GET on /types
returns a list but is not paginated. With this method in place,
Type.list now works like it would for anything else. Previously a call
to this would result in an infinite loop due to the pagination logic
having to identify when there is no more data, but the service always
returns more data (the same data, actually).

Change-Id: I3193f973a5c0ad00c2bebe477a8748fc7a7d7a5f

commit_message:
Add the Type resource for the Volume service

This change also enables documentation to start showing up for Volume
resources.

Change-Id: I3193f973a5c0ad00c2bebe477a8748fc7a7d7a5f

commit_message:
Add CADF notification handling for policy/region/service/endpoint

Since these events are now publicly available, we may now audit
them. Adding the necessary targets and tests.

partially implements bp: cadf-everywhere

Change-Id: I1cd089de30d1b44d82d12e1e4947ad23d5c7c876

commit_message:
Output account-reaper's logs for PolicyError

By some operational mistakes, policy settings can be inconsistent among
servers of swift cluster. Before this patch, if a policy setting of the
server where account-reaper daemon is running is different from other
servers, reap_object process failed without outputing error logs and
count up remaining objects.

Change-Id: Ic84fef7b49c77f0197f0bec4d41401686114d50e
Related-Bug: 1375384

commit_message:
Publicize region/endpoint/policy/service events

Start publicizing events for on create/update/delete events
for region/endpoint/policy/service. There was no reason to
not publicize them.

partially implements bp: cadf-everywhere

When reading logs, some exception message isn't informative
and has some typo, this patch change message in volume api.

APIImpact

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-02-09 23:27:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove versioning import of novaclient

novaclient has specific function novaclient.client.Client for obtaining 
client object. This fuction should be used instead of direct import.
Contrib path, also, depends on version, so we should get it based on 
versioned client.

Since implementation of v1.1 and v2 are equal in novaclient 
(the same client class is used, with same requests), there are several 
reasons to switch from V1.1 to V2:
- V1.1 can be marked as deprecated in near future 
( https://review.openstack.org/#/c/152569/ ) and annoying warnings 
will be printed.
- V2 is a latest nova api version.

Change-Id: If9c55446c4d10a58e9723f5c333082bcacb431b8
Closes-Bug: #1418017

commit_message:
Remove versioning import of novaclient

novaclient has specific function novaclient.client.Client for obtaining
client object. This fuction should be used instead of direct import.
Also, contrib path dependends on version, so we should get it based on
versioned client.

Change-Id: If9c55446c4d10a58e9723f5c333082bcacb431b8
Closes-Bug: #1418017

commit_message:
[Data processing] Fixing data source create form to be switchable

The data source creation form is now using the
switchable/switched mechanism for showing the
form fields that depend on the data source type.

Change-Id: I7584a0b777cb296bec2d5401e42488df8bd2aa9c
Closes-Bug: #1422483

commit_message:
Add general function for generating random names

Adding function gen_random_resource_name for generation random resources
that should be used in the integration tests. Mentioned method
automatically adds horizon string into the resource name in order to clearly
distinguish resource origin.

Also timestamp is added for better debugging of the tests in more
complex testcases.

uuid4 function is used to minimize resource name collisions.

Closes-Bug: #1399219
Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: Id5cb26e50b7b442af69798a2928be514adf7d8fe

commit_message:
Add support of x-remove- headers for container-sync

If the used tool to send header doesn't support empty headers (older versions
of curl), x-remove can be used to remove metadata.
sync-key and sync-to metadata, used by container-sync, can now be removed using
x-remove headers.

Change-Id: I0edb4d5425a99d20a973aa4fceaf9af6c2ddecc0

commit_message:
Increase Resource test coverage

There were a bunch of untested or partially tested branches, including
some that were not explicitly tested but only covered by their usage
elsewhere. This introduces a test class for the MutableMapping
functionality, tests the *_by_id methods and their branches, and several
other expansions on branch coverage. Combined with two other smaller
patches, this brings coverage to 100%.

Change-Id: Ie94662c90c98ea17ba3a927953a3804dc1c0f8c5

commit_message:
Various fixes to make it easier to run in diverse environments

Removed all the lsb helper utils from the sysv init script
Added a better error message for template missing.
Added the ability to skip the definition of the monasca_api_url
Made check frequency configurable and added an option to monasca setup
Also set the forwarder flush interval to be calculated based on check
frequency.
Modified monasca-setup so it can work with non-standard paths.

Change-Id: If8916e17bf42ffb804fa6c79166149a9fd33c553

commit_message:
Remove reference to self.services_sync

This is an implementation detail of fwaas and shouldn't be referenced
here.  There is no need to call self.process_services_sync on super.

Change-Id: I8797e40480c8c43788f4c192abddaf5d3e146e4c
Partially-Implements: bp/restructure-l3-agent
Depends-On: I6091ca2c03f2b5ffef453dea1152d2ac53bb7f14

commit_message:
VMWare NSXv: Add configuration params to nsx.ini

Adds some additional configuration parameters to nsx.ini, and their
description.
These parameters relate to NSXv metadata implementation.

Partially-Implements: blueprint vmware-nsx-v

commit_message:
Enable removing references to self.services_sync in l3 agent

The l3 agent shouldn't need to check services_sync because it is an
implementation detail of fwaas.  In order to get rid of it there, it
needs to be checked here.

Change-Id: I6091ca2c03f2b5ffef453dea1152d2ac53bb7f14
Needed-By: I8797e40480c8c43788f4c192abddaf5d3e146e4c

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-18 17:55:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/4dbe243cd84d_nsxv.py', 'neutron/plugins/vmware/dbexts/nsxv_models.py'], 'message': 'VMWare NSXv: id fields should be nullable

To handle concurrency issues when two neutron nodes initialize at the same
time, we use the following solution:
- Each neutron node attempts to create a record with id value=NULL
- One which inserts successfully, resumes to create the resource and once
the resource is created, it updates its id in the database
- One which fails with duplicate entry exception, busy-waits until the id
field is populated, of terminates on timeout.

Relevant resources are internal edges, and internal networks.

To implement the above, id fields should be nullable.

Change-Id: Iff94678ab341ccb1310d6b6efc53a52bd3bb9240
Partially-Implements: blueprint vmware-nsx-v
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
VMWare NSXv: id fields should be nullable

To handle concurrency issues when two neutron nodes initialize at the same
time, we use the following solution:
- Each neutron node attempts to create a record with id value=NULL
- One which inserts successfully, resumes to create the resource and once
the resource is created, it updates its id in the database
- One which fails with duplicate entry exception, busy-waits until the id
field is populated, of terminates on timeout.

Relevant resources are internal edges, and internal networks.

To implement the above, id fields should be nullable.

Change-Id: Iff94678ab341ccb1310d6b6efc53a52bd3bb9240
Partially-Implements: blueprint vmware-nsx-v

commit_message:
Remove remaining uses of passing root_helper

This should remove the last bits of passing root_helper around
for execute(). Some tests store and pass the root_helper argument
outside of this, and have been left alone.

Depends-On: I1e3b64e5a1d6cff2aebc638710487bbdbdba61d4

commit_message:
Adding data processing chapter

This change introduces the data processing service chapter as chapter 13
in the security guide.

Changes
* adding data processing chapter to index
* adding data processing chapter file
* adding introduction section file
* adding architecture image
* adding deployment section file
* adding configuration and hardening section file
* adding case studies section file
* adding data processing to the introduction to openstack section

Change-Id: I50c5066373f7c9bd75eb956cbb163f27d6a63058
Closes-bug: 1415218

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-09 16:25:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Generic Driver image supported protocols

Currently the generic driver is able to work with any images supplied,
but it is coded to use always NFS and CIFS helpers in order to interact
with the image. If a different image is used, for the purpose of other
share protocols, the above-mentioned helpers may not work. Since
image selection is up to ADM to set up in manila.conf, now there is
a new config option "image_supported_protocols" where a list of
protocols supported by the image should be specified, thus preventing
unecessary helpers from being initialized.

Change-Id: If0bebecb5005e4225f9aebc0a8332834d8600a83
Closes-bug: #1406759

commit_message:
Generic Driver image supported protocols

Currently the generic driver is able to work with any images supplied,
but it is coded to use always NFS and CIFS helpers in order to interact
with the image. If a different image is used, for the purpose of other
share protocols, the above-mentioned helpers may not work. Since
image selection is up to ADM to set up in manila.conf, the config option
"share_helpers" should be used to determine which helpers should be
initialized. Specifying an unsupported combination (helper and image)
will now print a proper error message during initialization and prevent
any additional resources from being used.

Change-Id: If0bebecb5005e4225f9aebc0a8332834d8600a83
Closes-bug: #1406759

subject: Add devstack plugin
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-20 17:38:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add devstack plugin

Start using devstack's feature 'Externally Hosted Plugins' [1], that allows
to install Manila using upstream Devstack without need to put some additional
files manually.

To enable Manila with Devstack just put following in local[rc] file:
enable_plugin manila git://git.openstack.org/openstack/manila

Above satisfies following template:
enable_plugin <NAME> <GITURL> [GITREF]
where
<NAME> is an arbitrary name. (ex: manila)
<GITURL> is a valid git url that can be cloned.
[GITREF] is an optional git ref (branch / ref / tag) that will be cloned. Defaults to master.

Also, there is no need to update list of enabled services anymore. Action of
plugin enabling is the only required.

Implements BP add-devstack-plugin
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/plugins.html#externally-hosted-plugins

Change-Id: I28eff33fc65aa741d9270d8bcb263a7fccd9baa4

commit_message:
Add devstack plugin

Start using devstack's feature 'Externally Hosted Plugins' [1], that allows
to install Manila using upstream Devstack without need to put some additional
files manually.

To enable Manila with Devstack just put following in local[rc] file:
enable_plugin manila https://github.com/openstack/manila

Above satisfies following template:
enable_plugin <NAME> <GITURL> [GITREF]
where
<NAME> is an arbitrary name. (ex: manila)
<GITURL> is a valid git url that can be cloned.
[GITREF] is an optional git ref (branch / ref / tag) that will be cloned. Defaults to master.

Plugin enables all Manila services by itself, no need to enable it manually anymore.

Implements BP add-devstack-plugin
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/plugins.html#externally-hosted-plugins

Change-Id: I28eff33fc65aa741d9270d8bcb263a7fccd9baa4

commit_message:
consume-external-ubuntu: extend qa tasks

Fuel QA team HAVE TO change system tests that way so they could use
extra repos for packages testing purpose.

Change-Id: Ib9370ed91679b99e6775136f943dc60074f4f745
Implements: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-05 05:29:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP: Modal operators "execute" and "permit"

Reactive enforcement of policies require users to specify actions on policy
violations. These actions need to be available as part of the datalog policy
statements. The current datalog semantics do not allow such option. This change
provides parsing and compiling for usage of "execute" and "permit" operators as
part of the policy statement. These statements are expected to be provided as
heads with the body containing the necessary conditions to perform the actions
indicated.

A sample policy may look like below:

execute[nova:delete(vm_id)] :- nova:servers(id=vm_id, flavor_id=flav_id), gt(flav_id, 2)

The above policy calls for a delete VM action if the flavor used is other than
"nano" or "tiny".

The commit implements
1. the necessary grammar specification in Congress.g.
2. Compiler enhancement to deal with Modal operators
3. A separate class "Modal" to provide functionalities on the lines of
Literals.

Runtime enhancements are work in progress.

Change-Id: Icbcb7c4810d9789ab4a19f146af0b59d229eb9ef

commit_message:
Modal operators "execute" and "permit"

Reactive enforcement of policies require users to specify actions on policy
violations. These actions need to be available as part of the datalog policy
statements. The current datalog semantics do not allow such option. This change
provides parsing and compiling for usage of "execute" and "permit" operators as
part of the policy statement. These statements are expected to be provided as
heads with the body containing the necessary conditions to perform the actions
indicated.

A sample policy may look like below:

execute[nova:delete(vm_id)] :- nova:servers(id=vm_id, flavor_id=flav_id), gt(flav_id, 2)

The above policy calls for a delete VM action if the flavor used is other than
"nano" or "tiny".

The commit implements
1. the necessary grammar specification in Congress.g.
2. Compiler enhancement to deal with Modal operators
3. A separate class "Modal" to provide functionalities on the lines of
Literals.

test_nonrecur is updated with insert/delete/select tests.

Change-Id: Icbcb7c4810d9789ab4a19f146af0b59d229eb9ef

dogtag plugin in order to add a new gate that run the functional test
suite against dogtag.

subject: Remove extra call to oauth manager from tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-20 19:51:10.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_oauth1.py'], 'message': "Remove extra call to oauth manager from tests

The oauth routes file creates an instance of oauth manager so
the tests don't need to create one also.
This will all be moved once oauth1 becomes loaded by default
in keystone.

Change-Id: I9a133cad0a69d37bcd79c013a7b49a458c313b47
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove extra call to oauth manager from tests

The oauth routes file creates an instance of oauth manager so
the tests don't need to create one also.
This will all be moved once oauth1 becomes loaded by default
in keystone.

Change-Id: I9a133cad0a69d37bcd79c013a7b49a458c313b47

[{'created': '2015-02-19 18:02:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Assume a new developer won't create a "desinate" user in the dev guide.

The getting started docs suggest checking the code out into `/var/lib`,
but this requires a later step of adding a `designate` user to the
sudoers list without adding a step of adding the `designate` user in the
first place.

This updates the docs and basic config example to simply check out the
code into `$HOME/openstack/designate/` and removes sudoers step.

commit_message:
Assume a new developer won't create a "designate" user in the dev guide

The getting started docs suggest checking the code out into `/var/lib`,
but this requires a later step of adding a `designate` user to the
sudoers list without adding a step of adding the `designate` user in the
first place.

This updates the docs and basic config example to simply check out the
code into `$HOME/openstack/designate/` and removes sudoers step.

Closes-Bug: 1423628
Change-Id: Ia30b5460532589417a7e8b1fad9c233ced954106

updating Vagrantfile default image and devstack config

[{'created': '2015-01-29 07:58:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add CADF notifications for most resources

implements bp: cadf-everywhere

Change-Id: Ibb9efa4369627a92cf5779fedfc53132472fa7e6
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-01-29 22:22:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add CADF notifications for most resources

Add a configuration option to emit CADF notifications for keystone
resources (project, user, role, etc...) for specific actions,
specifically: create/update/disable/delete.

The end user have a choice, in the form of a config option to enable
these notifications.

A seperate patch will include the refactoring needed in the manager
and controller classes to actually pass in the context, and get
the user's ID.

implements bp: cadf-everywhere

Change-Id: Ibb9efa4369627a92cf5779fedfc53132472fa7e6

commit_message:
Add CADF notifications for most resources

Add a configuration option to define notification format for Keystone
resources (project, user, role, etc...) for specific actions,
such as: create/update/delete.

The end user has a choice, in the form of a config option to emit
either cadf notifications, or the previous (basic) format.

A seperate patch will include the refactoring needed in the manager
and controller classes to actually pass in the context, and get
the user's ID.

implements bp: cadf-everywhere

Change-Id: Ibb9efa4369627a92cf5779fedfc53132472fa7e6

commit_message:
Remove an extra call to create federation manager

The federation manager is now loaded by default in backends.py
and is being loaded twice by keeping the old reference around.
Remove it as it's unnecessary.

Change-Id: I5250eee0b200b49508c200bd325cc7ff20399a14

subject: Make proxy_logging close the WSGI iterator
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-20 19:39:12.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/proxy_logging.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_proxy_logging.py'], 'message': "Make proxy_logging close the WSGI iterator

PEP 333 says that the WSGI framework will call .close() on the
iterator returned by a WSGI application once it's done, provided such
a method exists. So, if our code wraps an iterator, then we have to
call .close() on it once we're done with it. proxy_logging wasn't.

Since WSGIContext gets it right, I looked at making proxy_logging use
WSGIContext. However, WSGIContext is all about forcing the first chunk
out of the iterator so that it can capture the final HTTP status and
headers; it doesn't help if you want to look at every chunk.
proxy_logging wants every chunk so it can count the bytes sent.

This didn't hurt anything in Swift, but pconstantine was complaining
in IRC that our failure to call .close() was goofing up some other
middleware he had.

Change-Id: Ic6ea0795ccef6cda2b5c6737697ef7d58eac9ab4
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make proxy_logging close the WSGI iterator

PEP 333 says that the WSGI framework will call .close() on the
iterator returned by a WSGI application once it's done, provided such
a method exists. So, if our code wraps an iterator, then we have to
call .close() on it once we're done with it. proxy_logging wasn't.

Since WSGIContext gets it right, I looked at making proxy_logging use
WSGIContext. However, WSGIContext is all about forcing the first chunk
out of the iterator so that it can capture the final HTTP status and
headers; it doesn't help if you want to look at every chunk.
proxy_logging wants every chunk so it can count the bytes sent.

This didn't hurt anything in Swift, but pconstantine was complaining
in IRC that our failure to call .close() was goofing up some other
middleware he had.

Change-Id: Ic6ea0795ccef6cda2b5c6737697ef7d58eac9ab4

commit_message:
Added a migrate_settings command

This command allows to easily save a diff between local_settings.py and
local_settings.py.example to reapply the change when local_settings.py.example
changes (per branch switch or updates).

implements bp settings-migration-script

Change-Id: I2668bbf248434a5d437a5fc46ad07c1a1f29b793

commit_message:
Remove list_endpoint_groups_for_project from sample policies

The "identity:list_endpoint_groups_for_project" was defined in
the sample policy files but there's no actual mapping for it, so
setting a value for this target has no effect. If or when the
mapping gets added then this target must be added back in.

Change-Id: I1843bf61681944ae82c3325e0bb00c32ca8f1c16
Related-Bug: 1421968

commit_message:
Cinder REST API for angular front end

This is a very early cut at the REST API needed to
support the create instance wizard work.

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign
Co-Authored-By: Michael Hagedorn <mike.hagedorn@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Richard Jones <r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Travis Tripp <travis.tripp@hp.com>

Change-Id: I0c37474e81f5ee9893768974e47a20532c535b91

subject: Add get_endpoint_group_in_project to sample policy files

[{'created': '2015-02-14 16:05:00.000000000', 'files': ['etc/policy.v3cloudsample.json', 'etc/policy.json'], 'message': "Add get_endpoint_group_in_project to sample policy files

The `identity:get_endpoint_group_in_project` target was missing
from the sample policy files. It's defined in
keystone.contrib.endpoint_filter.routers for

 GET /OS-EP-FILTER/endpoint_groups/{endpoint_group_id}/projects/
     {project_id}

Change-Id: I15dd3965743a567918d7781b9831640745f70efc
Closes-Bug: 1421971
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add get_endpoint_group_in_project to sample policy files

The `identity:get_endpoint_group_in_project` target was missing
from the sample policy files. It's defined in
keystone.contrib.endpoint_filter.routers for

 GET /OS-EP-FILTER/endpoint_groups/{endpoint_group_id}/projects/
     {project_id}

Change-Id: I15dd3965743a567918d7781b9831640745f70efc
Closes-Bug: 1421971

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-20 19:57:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Stale VXLAN and GRE tunnel port/flow deletion

Description:
Stale GRE and VXLAN tunnel endpoints persists in neutron db this should be
deleted from the database. Also, if local_ip of L2 agent changes the
stale tunnel ports and flows persists on br-tun on other Compute Nodes and
Network Nodes for that remote ip this should also be removed.

Implementation

Plugin changes:
Added host column in 'ml2_vxlan_endpoints' and 'ml2_gre_endpoints' table.
Added delete_endpoint method for deleting the stale endpoints from db.
Modified tunnel_sync() method to accommodate these changes.
Modified testcases in test_type_vxlan.py
Modified testcases in test_type_gre.py

Agent changes:
Added tunnel_delete rpc for removing stale ports and flows from br-tun.
tunnel_sync rpc signature upgrade to obtain 'host'.
Added testcases for TunnelRpcCallbackMixin().

This patch-set basically deals with agent side changes.

Closes-Bug: #1179223
Closes-Bug: #1381071

DocImpact

Change-Id: I291992ffde5c3ab7152f0d7462deca2e4ac1ba3f
Co-Authored-By: phanipawan <ppawan@hp.com>

stale tunnel ports and flows persists on br-tun on other Compute Nodes and
Network Nodes for that remote ip this should also be removed.

Implementation

Plugin changes:
Added host column in 'ml2_vxlan_endpoints' and 'ml2_gre_endpoints' table.
Added delete_endpoint method for deleting the stale endpoints from db.
Modified tunnel_sync() method to accommodate these changes.
Modified testcases in test_type_vxlan.py
Modified testcases in test_type_gre.py

Agent changes:
Added tunnel_delete rpc for removing stale ports and flows from br-tun.
tunnel_sync rpc signature upgrade to obtain 'host'.
Added testcases for TunnelRpcCallbackMixin().

This patch-set agent deals with agent side changes.

Closes-Bug: #1179223
Closes-Bug: #1381071

commit_message:
Stale VXLAN and GRE tunnel port/flow deletion

Description:
Stale GRE and VXLAN tunnel endpoints persists in neutron db this should be
deleted from the database. Also, if local_ip of L2 agent changes the
stale tunnel ports and flows persists on br-tun on other Compute Nodes and
Network Nodes for that remote ip this should also be removed.

Implementation

Plugin changes:
The plugin side changes are covered in following patch-set
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121000/.

Agent changes:
Added tunnel_delete rpc for removing stale ports and flows from br-tun.
tunnel_sync rpc signature upgrade to obtain 'host'.
Added testcases for TunnelRpcCallbackMixin().

This patch-set agent deals with agent side changes.

Closes-Bug: #1179223
Closes-Bug: #1381071
Closes-Bug: #1276629

Co-Authored-By: Aman Kumar <amank@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: phanipawan <ppawan@hp.com>

Change-Id: I291992ffde5c3ab7152f0d7462deca2e4ac1ba3f

commit_message:
Refactor to facilitate DVR scale performance

To facilitate work for DVR scale performance improvements, refactor
l3_agentschedulers_db.list_active_sync_routers_on_active_l3_agent
to pull out logic that will be overridden into the private method
_get_active_l3_agent_routers_sync_data

Partial-Bug: 1413314

Change-Id: Ia454b037529c9b6f3750a67dc0eabb7e01419ea8

commit_message:
Remove pysqlite requirement

pysqlite installation is failing in the devstack gate.  We don't need
any pysqlite features anyway, so we should use sqlite3 from the stdlib
instead.

Change-Id: I7b069e54ac9615bc94eb9cb53b2d46b7b35bef6e

commit_message:
Add Magic Search for filtering in Horizon

Magic Search is an AngularJS widget that provides 
UI for faceted and text search. It was created by
Eucalyptus and recently open-sourced by HP. See
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FTjqFddBJBA
for a 30-second demo.

This will allow Horizon to support API-level
filtering with high usability, while still
supporting client-side filtering.

Implements: blueprint filtered-client-side-table

commit_message:
Add new angular deps to global-requirements.txt for Horizon

These dependencies allow drag and drop interaction in horizon with data.
Example of usage include but not limited to table row reordering via dnd.

Change-Id: Ic4dbdd2a380860e4a50a3b2c0ceeb1814a3aff0d

Update spec so that '-ED' states should not be used

Momentary states (-ED) should not be used unless they are needed.
Update the spec to indicate this.

commit_message:
Ensure we install tempest-lib from git in tempest's tox venv

This commit adds installing tempest-lib from git to the tempest full
job's tox venv. Since by default tempest isn't being installed
globally anymore and when we do run tempest it is normally within a
tox venv that means previously the install from git flag isn't being
taken into account.

Change-Id: I98b0754c4a91690c9402fa2ae2c3e9ba9195d444

commit_message:
Exposing the vip_port_id attribute of a load balancer

Also cleaning up the functions that transformed the data models
into dictionaries.  Added a to_api_dict() method off each data model
so the to_dict() method can be used for internal code purposes.

Also, this inadvertently fixed another bug that wasn't populating
the provider on a loadbalancer.  Added tests for this.

Change-Id: I99a3ac7b4426da893cb939ffeba986201352f6da
Closes-bug: 1421465

commit_message:
Chain exceptions correctly on py3.x

In order to chain exceptions add a helper that can
be used to chain exceptions automatically (when able)
and use it in the various places we are already creating
a new exception with a prior cause so that on py3.x the
newly created exception has its 'cause' associated using
the syntax available to do chaining in py3.x (which formats
nicely as well in that python version).

Change-Id: Iffddb27dbfe80816d6032e4b5532a0011ceedc95

commit_message:
Remove UUID from root device hints

It's only possible to get an UUID from a partition fileystem, not from
a disk device.

Change-Id: Id486c529c795bbc2ccbe747d21183a0e53d83df7

commit_message:
Fix check for missing subheadings

If a spec heading is missing entirely, and subheadings are expected,
the heading was being used in a key lookup causing an exception.

Change-Id: I44fb2b9c701cf359433211e876d2f6b3d1dbec5c

This set of changes introduces the ML2 mechanism driver for Cisco
UCS manager. This is a WIP implementation that configures SR-IOV

a handful of Neutron and Nova BPs to fully implement SR-IOV support
on OS.

commit_message:
Implements a ML2 mechanism driver for Cisco UCS Manager

This set of changes introduces the ML2 mechanism driver for Cisco
UCS Manager. This new mechanism driver configures SR-IOV virtual
functions controlled by UCS manager based on the network the
physical function (associated with the virtual function) is on.

Implements: blueprint ml2-ucs-manager-mechanism-driver

DocImpact

Change-Id: If1d5169c563a19e781a0d16d9560fc231ba4251c

commit_message:
Allow MiniDNS to Send Everything Over TCP

*Adds a configurable option all-tcp, that when enabled sends NOTIFYs and
SOA queries over TCP, instead of UDP.

Change-Id: I16447568f770210a75a70fb55d45a5e7a9c1a84e

commit_message:
Fixing CSS namespace collision over wizard

https://review.openstack.org/137417 added a new "wizard" css class.
Unfortunately, this class already existed and had meaning in the
existing wizard implementation. So renaming new wizard class to
"ng-wizard" to remove the collision.

Change-Id: I8bfe46721a9881a46c842bdb7f5699ae80b7ed93
Closes-Bug: #1423888

Changing YAQL syntax delimeters

Implements blueprint yaql-delimiters

commit_message:
Unwedge stable/icehouse by manually installing a capped novaclient

Install novaclient prior to OSC, as per GR.  This avoids OSC's
uncapped requirements pulling in a newer novaclient, which requires
a keystoneclient version conflicting with stable/icehouse.

This can be removed once work is complete to install OSC into a
venv.

Change-Id: Id43b249f3d685ec0ffe0a892fe8461a2ab0415db
Related-bug: #1423753

subject: Adjust Container override methods
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-17 06:58:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Adjust Container override methods

Because the object store works differently than what the Resource base
class provides, there are two overrides: create and update. However,
they weren't completed, so while they mostly functioned, they were
returning only the dictionary of headers and not putting that through
the Container initializer.

This change does roughly the same thing as before by sharing code
between the update and create calls, as they only differ in the
actual HTTP call. The base Resource.update method works fine with the
udpate_by_id override now provided, but Resource.create attempts to set
an ID out of the response body, which we do not get on Container.create,
so it overrides and avoids that step.

Three tests were removed from the suite because they were testing the
allow_create flag on instances of Container from the previous chain of
methods. Now that this is all using classmethods like anything else,
these tests don't make sense.

Change-Id: Ia518179517b38cf185bcd070825af15c7875e688

commit_message:
Adjust Container override methods

Because the object store works differently than what the Resource base
class provides, there are two overrides: create and update. However,
they weren't completed, so while they mostly functioned, they were
returning only the dictionary of headers and not putting that through
the Container initializer.

This change does roughly the same thing as before by sharing code
between the update and create calls, as they only differ in the
actual HTTP call. The base Resource.update method works fine with the
udpate_by_id override now provided, but Resource.create attempts to set
an ID out of the response body, which we do not get on Container.create,
so it overrides and avoids that step.

Three tests were removed from the suite because they were testing the
allow_create flag on instances of Container from the previous chain of
methods. Now that this is all using classmethods like anything else,
these tests don't make sense.

Change-Id: Ia518179517b38cf185bcd070825af15c7875e688

commit_message:
Fix bug in tests assuming order is active

One test for orders was assuming that the order would become set
to ACTIVE right after the create. In some environments the
order could remain pending and would not have a secret ref to check in
the test.

Change-Id: Ifd33fb0e321c1cfca9202a44fcb3d132421b0e79

commit_message:
Reduce logstash and elasticsearch memory heap size for AIO

This patch reduces the memory heap size for the elasticsearch and
logstash services for the AIO build. This is for the purpose of
improving the reliability of gate commit checks.

Conflicts:
        rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/elasticsearch.yml
        rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/logstash.yml

Closes-Bug: #1423242
Change-Id: I614ac2a3985ba002fe7de0a1704731a44a8928bc
(cherry picked from commit 6776327736799a93f5f047d38170d1b16b3edf3a)

commit_message:
Fix import_no_virt_driver_import_deps check

The format of the pep8 variable filename does not starts with "./" 
so files would be "nova" not "./nova/"

Change-Id: I6c324d0005210c0c5cb9666c105089319e5292e2

commit_message:
Updates of OpenStack client versions to support tempest

This patch updates the following OpenStack clients:
 - python-cinderclient to 1.1.0
 - python-keystoneclient to 0.11.1

This is to support tempest requirements at
7c73dd5b18d29f0f3f3be0088514121dade53c8f

Change-Id: I3b667640cb8a1a8f5b6161cd724bb6fccd8d4424
Closes-Bug: #1423959

commit_message:
Updating containers on object fast-POST

This document proposes modifications to enable
fast-POST updates of content-type to be accurately
reflected in container listings and be eventually
consistent across object and container servers.

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I60688efc3df692d3a39557114dca8c5490f7837e

commit_message:
Fix idempotency of migration 269

Migration 269 was not written to be idempotent, as is the policy/convention for
our migrations whenever possible. This trivially fixes that.

Change-Id: Ic079a9dee98e8c6f1803243805b6f2926a1d8227

commit_message:
Remove unused touch command filter

Looks like the touch command hasn't been used in
nova/virt/disk/api.py since folsom.  It also doesn't appear to be
used anywhere else within the Nova codebase.

Change-Id: I322a9eeee291ed9cd45e4dc71fa7ac65f6cc9b69

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6802, 'name': 'Joel Coffman', 'email': 'jmc7tp@gmail.com', 'username': 'joel-coffman'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11103, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'otc_cloud@163.com', 'username': 'intelotccloud', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11864, 'name': 'Ben Roble', 'email': 'ben.roble@rackspace.com', 'username': 'broble'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-13 20:42:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix data loss on resize up

WORK-IN-PROGRESS

Resize up does not copy all data to the destination if data is written
between the start of the resize and the shutdown of the instance.

It seems we copy only the empty snapshot marker VDI instead of the VDI
that the VM keeps writing to during the resize operation. This fix
changes resize up behavior to copy the correct VDI.

Change-Id: I5eebdfaaa82481726ba6ce2a946773b6ea503905
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john@johngarbutt.com>
Closes-Bug: #1421707

commit_message:
XenAPI: Fix data loss on resize up

Resize up does not copy all data to the destination if data is written
between the start of the resize and the shutdown of the instance.

It seems we copy only the empty snapshot marker VDI instead of the VDI
that the VM keeps writing to during the resize operation. This fix
changes resize up behavior to copy the correct VDI.

Change-Id: I5eebdfaaa82481726ba6ce2a946773b6ea503905
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john@johngarbutt.com>
Closes-Bug: #1421707

commit_message:
Add service catalog get for keystone REST API

This adds full access to the keystone service catalog for the user.

The service catalog can be used to determine whether or not
Neutron or Nova networking is enabled. This is needed in
launch instance.

Change-Id: I9e19563b0d9b8d106274d6806b302eb01bb51915
Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign

[{'created': '2015-01-29 07:42:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use newer python-ldap paging control API

The API for using the LDAP simple paged results control changed
between python-ldap version 2.3 and 2.4. Our current implementation
fails with an AttributeError when trying to use paging with version
2.4 of python-ldap.

This patch detects the capabilities of the underlying python-ldap
version and uses the newer API in versions of python-ldap that have
removed the older API.

Conflicts:
    keystone/common/ldap/core.py

commit_message:
Use newer python-ldap paging control API

The API for using the LDAP simple paged results control changed
between python-ldap version 2.3 and 2.4. Our current implementation
fails with an AttributeError when trying to use paging with version
2.4 of python-ldap.

This patch detects the capabilities of the underlying python-ldap
version and uses the newer API in versions of python-ldap that have
removed the older API.

Conflicts:
    keystone/common/ldap/core.py

Change-Id: I2986e12daea3edf50f299af5927d2a05278e82f7
Closes-bug: #1381768
(cherry picked from commit 1be4a15454e6917571bc937e3bb3589e8f79bc55)
(cherry picked from commit db291b340e63b74d8d240abfc37d03fb163f33f1)

Just remove event log check for transient clusters.

commit_message:
Support for the Volume service

This change adds some support for Cinder v2

* Resources for Volumes, Types, and Snapshots
* Proxy implementations for Volumes and Types

Since this change is pretty large I am leaving the Snapshot proxy
implementation to another change, and the same goes for addition to the
user guide.

Change-Id: I46e58fd676eab3b189294fc3a41ac0e2b495b81a

commit_message:
Fix some message nits in the ZoneManager

This patch addresses some nit comments I've received on some of the
ZoneManager's conf options (e.g., not documenting the valid zoning
strategies) and some other minor message format items.

Cleaned up some globalization items as well (% => ,).

Also fixed the UTs since they didn't work at all due to duplicate
opt errors based on the UT structure.

Change-Id: I84b55710bd8afe4fcdd539fcc49805ba88d13dc4
Closes-Bug: 1423450

commit_message:
Fix PEP8 E121 & E122 errors

Fix PEP8 E121 & E122 errors
 E121: continuation line under-indented for hanging indent
 E122: continuation line missing indentation or outdented

Remove E121 & E122 from the ignore list for flake8

Change-Id: If63dd80ee85fc97596492e0b2cb6db9e10458c54

Replace oslo-incubator with oslo_context

openstack.common.context is currently moved out of the incubator
to a standalone project, hence replace it with oslo_context in nova.

commit_message:
Fix baremetal node property keys

The baremetal_client is creating test nodes with property keys that
don't match what the nova os-baremetal-nodes extension is pulling out of
the node properties from the ironic client. This results in KeyErrors
when this test runs in parallel to other baremetal tests that were added
to Tempest on 2/16 with commit ac0879accd2a451c54ed935297a6f8e0a8aaf25a.

Closes-Bug: #1423427

Co-authored-by: Adam Gandelman <adamg@ubuntu.com>

Change-Id: I3593f58de5088d2442fddd52c6a11d055bb4f6a0

commit_message:
Remove CONF values from Token clients

To move Token clients to tempest-lib, this patch moves
CONF values from Token clients to the client setting and classes
instantiate Token clients.

Also making necessary changes in tests files.

Change-Id: Ie405ba6a71d29258e99d2f0b68afb013a9619e9b

commit_message:
Mock sleep function for OtherFunctionTestCase

Previously the test:
ironic.tests.drivers.test_deploy_utils.OtherFunctionTestCase.test_is_block_device_raises

was taking around 3 seconds to run and showing up as the slowest test
case.  With this patch this test case no longer shows up in the list of
slowest test cases.

Change-Id: I8782c9b3ba087bffa0b4147261f06d1df352d060

commit_message:
clear dict post cleanup in clear_isolated_creds

clear_isolated_creds method is called twice once from base class
and once from test.py. But second time it fails as the user and
tenant are already deleted. So if first time clear_isolated_creds
is called clear the isolated_creds variable after user/tenant
deletion. Similarly isolated_net_resources also needs to be cleared
once the resources are deleted.

Change-Id: I577524166a74b235604442e67003706d897ac4d2
Closes-Bug: 1375230

commit_message:
processutils: postpone eventlet monkey patching check

We should not check whether time module is monkey patched during import
since in that case we force our consumers to maintain some specific
import order, which is sometimes hard or impossible.

Instead of checking during import, do it on demand when execute() is
actually issued.

Change-Id: Ic465c343cd3cc9144127ee5dd11714bdde300a42
Closes-Bug: #1418541

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-11 21:49:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'sanity_check: introduce magic to easily add new version checks

Introduce a new version.Checker() class that may be used as a callable
for sanity checks. It introspects neutron.cmd.sanity.checks module and
handles all common operations (comparing versions, handling exceptions,
logging errors), allowing to easily add more version based checks.

The only things that a developer needs to provide now to add a new
version check are the following functions:

- get_cur_%name_version
- get_min_%name_version

Co-Authored-By: Sridhar Gaddam <sridhar.gaddam@enovance.com>
Change-Id: I5615070e335f8e23fc22dd5e7b1af6bb57979e16

commit_message:
sanity_check: introduce magic to easily add new version checks

Introduce a new version.Checker() class that may be used as a callable
for sanity checks. It introspects neutron.cmd.sanity.checks module and
handles all common operations (comparing versions, handling exceptions,
logging errors), allowing to easily add more version based checks.

The only things that a developer needs to provide now to add a new
version check is one function (get_%name_version) and a new entry in
AVAILABLE_CHECKS.

Also made dnsmasq version check to use the new class.

Relocated all version related code into neutron.cmd.sanity.version.

Co-Authored-By: Sridhar Gaddam <sridhar.gaddam@enovance.com>
Change-Id: I5615070e335f8e23fc22dd5e7b1af6bb57979e16

commit_message:
Add invalid "get_*_(list|show)" pattern to T108

Most list methods' names are "list_<resource name>s" but some methods
are "get_<resource name>_list" now. In addition, a method name is
"get_<resource name>_show" and duplicated meanings. This patch adds
them as invalid method names to T108 rule and renames some methods
for consistent names.

Change-Id: I2b0ecfec4554dd82f5ecd292c9eb597c37eed37f

commit_message:
Adding api tests for dvr routers

in network_client.py:
update_router in json/network_client.py did not provide a way to update
the 'distributed' attribute of a router. Sending a rest call to a
system that does not support dvr (icehouse and older) or aa system with
dvr extension disabled will cause a failure, thus care must be taken to
only include the attribute in the rest call if it is explicitely
requested via the kwargs dict.

Tests Added:
-test_distributed_router_creation
-test_centralized_router_creation
-test_centralized_router_update_to_dvr

Change-Id: I19fb6fc260ac5aaf9b2a1456ade242bc3ee93b8d

get_floating_ip_details() contains NotFound raise, but the exception

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove unused NotFound raise

get_floating_ip_details() contains NotFound raise, but the exception
would never happen because previous tempest-lib's get() raises it
if HTTP404 is gotten. So this patch removes it.

Change-Id: Ia7f18dfb7491d7379e0ab55b8f84c8b10b7ebb33

commit_message:
Enable non-voting keystoneclient functional tests

Turn on basic functional testing for keystoneclient. This will initially
import the tests from tempest.

There is currently only 1 trivial functional test so this will become
gating as soon as we can validate the configuration.

Change-Id: I256deb532f0d73bf9a6efb8c9a353a52cd1eb281

commit_message:
Remove eventlet monkey patch in mistral __init__

Eventlet monkey patch in mistral/__init__.py leads to "unable to
switch thread" error when hosting the mistral API under apache.

subject: Provide one resource for Compute v2 Limits
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-14 20:05:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Provide one resource for Compute v2 Limits

This change makes use of having Resources as property types and provides
one parent resource, Limits, to interact with the /limits REST API. As
this response body contains two different types of limits with two
different structures, it offers Limits.absolute and Limits.rate, which
replace the two separate resources that currently exist that require two
API calls to work with. Limits.absolute is an AbsoluteLimits instance,
and Limits.rate is a list of RateLimit instances.

The interaction would now work as follows:

my_limits = limits.Limits().get(session)
print(my_limits.absolute.server_meta) # 128 by default
for limits in my_limits.rate: # iterate over URIs with limits
    print(limits.uri) # prints "*/servers"
    for limit in limits:
        print(limit) # print the specific rate limits on this URI

Change-Id: I5363d2e39dcc57f9fd164ec88ab5b79abeaa18ed
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-02-15 05:38:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Provide one resource for Compute v2 Limits

replace the two separate resources that currently exist that require two
API calls to work with. Limits.absolute is an AbsoluteLimits instance,
and Limits.rate is a list of RateLimit instances.

The interaction would now work as follows:

my_limits = limits.Limits().get(session)

commit_message:
Provide one resource for Compute v2 Limits

This change makes use of having Resources as property types and provides
one parent resource, Limits, to interact with the /limits REST API. As
this response body contains two different types of limits with two
different structures, it offers Limits.absolute and Limits.rate, which
replace the two separate resources that currently exist that require two
API calls to work with. Limits.absolute is an AbsoluteLimits instance,
and Limits.rate is a list of RateLimit instances.

The interaction would now work as follows:

my_limits = limits.Limits().get(session)
print(my_limits.absolute.server_meta) # 128 by default
for limits in my_limits.rate: # iterate over URIs with limits
    print(limits.uri) # prints "*/servers"
    for limit in limits:
        print(limit) # print the specific rate limits on this URI

Change-Id: I5363d2e39dcc57f9fd164ec88ab5b79abeaa18ed
Closes-Bug: 1422057

commit_message:
Fail main maven build if java maven build fails

Java maven sub build could fail and main maven build still
succeed because of the shell script in between. Pass the maven
exit code back

Change-Id: I4df4ee7d782db21c89c49b0ee0a4741cbfa97edb

commit_message:
purge all pure python libraries

python libraries should be installed from upstream, not from the
distro, as much as possible. The following is a first attempt at
purging all the python libraries and making it so that they instead
should fall back to the pypi versions.

Libraries which are known to include native code are left behind.

Change-Id: I47b7e787771683c2fc4404e586f11c1a19aac15c

commit_message:
Revamp README file

The README used only python-*client objects, thus defeating the
purpose of shade, which is about putting a facade for all those
interfaces to simplify things.
README now shows you can use shade simplified interface and also
access the underlying python-*client API objects.

Change-Id: I0c638beab615177fc6ce3704c5443a3394a87ed0

This modifies the CLI so that the argument names, metavar names
and help strings are more consistent.

Argument names that consist of more than one word are now separated
by hyphens instead of underscores. Existing argument names with
underscores are still supported but not displayed via help. The new

Help strings were updated. Among other things, they are treated like
sentences with the first letter in upper case, and a period at the end.

commit_message:
Consistent names of args and metavars, and help strings

This modifies the CLI so that the argument names, metavar names
and help strings are more consistent.

Argument names that consist of more than one word are now separated
by hyphens instead of underscores. Existing argument names with
underscores are still supported but not displayed via help. The new
argument names are: http_method -> http-method, chassis_uuid -> chassis,
driver_info -> driver-info, node_uuid -> node.

Metavars are only used in the help strings displayed to the user. For
consistency, they are lowercased with hyphens to separate the
words. (Using spaces might make someone think that more than one argument
is needed.)

Help strings were updated. Among other things, they are treated like
sentences with the first letter in upper case, and a period at the end.

Closes-Bug: #1420318
Change-Id: If05d51b09d787ccfbf6f6d35d8e752d42f673601

commit_message:
Added new hook to copy files

* added new hook to copy files and test
* after migrating generating and uploading keys into tasks
  we can remove predeployment actions for this tasks

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Rename oslo_release.sh to library_release.sh

more suitable for use by libraries maintained outside of Oslo.

commit_message:
Reinstate the devstack-dsvm-cells job for novaclient

A recent release of a novaclient broke several projects which
gate on the devstack-dsvm-cells job. This change adds the job
back to novaclient.

Related-Bug: #1423695

Change-Id: I435036cce2382bb0b4596d4a1b19e98885e92702

commit_message:
Fix index name in downgrade 26b54cf9024d migration

In downgrade of migration 26b54cf9024d_add_index_on_allocated is
trying to drop index 'ix_ml2_vxlan_allocations_allocated',
which is not exits.

Closes-bug: #1421618

Change-Id: I4c75e78512cc6d112a23ab5c7de6e8ca104891b0

commit_message:
Add vCenter driver instance name section

Add instance name section to VMware configuration reference.
KVM use instance_template name but VMware vCenter driver
use instance ID.

commit_message:
Improve List Role Assignment Tests

Add new tests to role_assignments API.
Filters + effective mode are combined in order to
cover all allowed and forbidden cases.

Closes-Bug: 1396083

commit_message:
fix for _get_external_device_interface_name trace

On removal of external gateway from DVR the code path
external_gateway_removed(...) was trying to access the
agent gateway port interface even when no fip namespace exists.
This change checks for existence of namespace before
accessing the agent gateway port interface through
_get_external_device_interface_name(...) or looking for
floating ips that may have been configured on the
port.

Change-Id: Idcf28ff93f16f1d692fe7acb678fb90aabe5af5e
Closes-Bug: #1421497

commit_message:
[install-guide] do not synchronize Neutron DB on openSUSE/SLES

It is not necessary to manually synchronize the Neutron DB on
openSUSE/SLES because neutron-manage-db is part of the
init file.

Change-Id: I4a9f7fa37de58449e764a3d1bd24b7ed663c8eef
Partial-Bug: 1422281
Backport: Juno

commit_message:
Add check for non-existing table internal name for delete table

This change added check for non-existing internal name for tables
which caused exception when trying to delete table in CREATE_FAILED
or DELETE_FALED status if table internal name does not exist.

Change-Id: I3175a364a4e678f35b860db26f9dec999997f8a0
Closes-bug: #1422908

subject: Don't create stack-volume-default in lib/cinder
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-16 23:57:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't create stack-volume-default in lib/cinder

In the past lib/cinder would always call
init_default_lvm_volume_group which would use the
/lib/lvm default VG name of stack-volumes-default.
We switched over to using the be_type and be_name
to create and use stack-volume-lvmdriver-X, but we
now have both calls in place.

The result is that we have two VG's, one on the loop
device named stack-volumes-default which actually
isn't used by the Cinder tests, and another on
/dev/vdX that's actually the intended Cinder VG.

To reiterate, the current gate tests are in fact only
using the stack-volumes-lvmdrver-X VG.

Closes-Bug: #1422532

This may be in order to preserve compat for Grenade tests, but we should probably do something a bit better to keep from having an unused VG in the standard dsvm full run to eliminate some confusion.

Change-Id: I8e8b40f1d0d1ad7be0f9abf210ab1ea52c7468a3

commit_message:
Don't create stack-volume-default in lib/cinder

In the past lib/cinder would always call
init_default_lvm_volume_group which would use the
/lib/lvm default VG name of stack-volumes-default.
We switched over to using the be_type and be_name
to create and use stack-volume-lvmdriver-X, but we
now have both calls in place.

The result is that we have two VG's, one on the loop
device named stack-volumes-default which actually
isn't used by the Cinder tests, and another on
/dev/vdX that's actually the intended Cinder VG.

To reiterate, the current gate tests are in fact only
using the stack-volumes-lvmdrver-X VG.

Closes-Bug: #1422532

Change-Id: I8e8b40f1d0d1ad7be0f9abf210ab1ea52c7468a3

commit_message:
Make Default value for Groups column translatable.


Here we are passing a default string 'False' to empty_value, which is not
translatable as we haven't used the function ugettext().
So to make it translatable we are using this function.

Closes-Bug: #1399308
Change-Id: Ie568118ad702fbbe80b4ae26fbc863524037342c

commit_message:
Reduce logstash and elasticsearch memory heap size for AIO

This patch reduces the memory heap size for the elasticsearch and
logstash services for the AIO build. This is for the purpose of
improving the reliability of gate commit checks.

Closes-Bug: #1423242
Change-Id: I614ac2a3985ba002fe7de0a1704731a44a8928bc

commit_message:
Nova changes required for standalone EC2 API implementation

Some of the information required for EC2 API, currently supported by
existing nova's EC2 API implemenation is not exposed by public
nova APIs. This spec lists these omissions and provides suggestions
about how to expose them.

APIImpact
Implements: blueprint ec2-api

Change-Id: I4102808405fef420f159dcbd46293f50cec56f0f

commit_message:
Fix issue with doc build

Sphinx doc build has issues if the path to a resource is relative.
This adds a symbolic link instead of a relative path. See [1] for more
details.

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/70/157470/4/check/gate-telcowg-usecases-docs/c29956c/console.html

Change-Id: I76ef25fbc3876408a422d826974510a978fcb686
