commit_message:
Retry installing apt packages by default

There are a number of tasks used to install apt packages. Some of the
tasks will retry on failure and others will not. These tasks are
susceptible to failure and so it makes sense that they retry if the
task fails.

This commit updates the apt tasks so that they all retry with the
default retries and delay values of 3 and 5 respectively. In addition
all the tasks will attempt to update the cache if it is older than
600 seconds.

Some of the apt tasks had the state set to latest, this has been
changed to present because upgrades should be handled by specific
upgrade tasks.

Closes-Bug: #1421238
Change-Id: I8c20c5c0a2ce87706a99734adcdf55c93efb405c
(cherry picked from commit 19f86f4c00099d5994d77a9fe8f431d9373b15a5)

commit_message:
Add retry and fallback server capability to apt-key tasks

This patch adds retries (with a delay) to the common and
container_common apt-key tasks, then also includes an optional retry
using a fallback keyserver for the appropriate tasks.

The patch also removes the conditional for the platform version as it is
not entirely relevant at this stage - the whole environment is only
tested to work on Ubuntu 14.04 anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1423123
Change-Id: Ica590a61319f60beaa8c6d6f4b8210400efca922
(cherry picked from commit 16c2a5fc4a13481433e091598bb19009b5d3683e)

commit_message:
Add Measurements section to Telemetry Admin Guide

Add a new section to the admin guide of Telemetry to list the available
metrics and other metrics related information. This patch adds the base
file, which will contain the references for the  tables with some general
information about the metrics stored in Telemetry.

Change-Id: I085af5818ca90497144de5b1a70dbfa939cd7ccc

commit_message:
Fixes Create Network & Subnet Modals

This reverts some CSS changes added by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/137417/ which break the Create
Network modal, as well as the Create and Edit Subnet modals.

Specifically:
- Removes the unnecessary scroll bar
- Realigns modal on the page
- Fixes workflow tab alignment

Change-Id: I15fa29781e4bc3a400a5599e083ec24ec93fe188

commit_message:
Glance image delete output

Deleting an already deleted image using admin user is throwing an
error "404 Not Found" which is confusing. Deleting an image that does
not exist throws "No image with a name or ID of 'image-id' exists."

Updated the code so that trying to delete an already deleted image
throws "No image with an ID of 'image-id' exists." error.

Closes-Bug: #1333119
Change-Id: I8f9a6174663337a0f48aafa029a4339c32eb2134
Co-Authored-By: Abhishek Talwar <abhishek.talwar@tcs.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kamil Rykowski <kamil.rykowski@intel.com>

subject: Add logging functionality to openstack.utils
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-05 03:49:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add logging functionality to openstack.utils

This change moves the ability to enable logging out of the
examples.common module and into the openstack.utils since it is
generally useful.

Note: documentation is going to be handled separately because I don't
want this change to have to depend on the current chain of doc reorg
changes which may take a while to get reviews due to their size.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-openstacksdk/+bug/1418307 will track
the documentation of this feature.

Change-Id: Ic8768d529d0389b9b04bd4ea31453a82f30faf33
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-02-16 23:29:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/users/utils.rst', 'openstack/tests/test_utils.py', 'doc/source/users/index.rst', 'examples/common.py', 'openstack/utils.py'], 'message': 'Add logging functionality to openstack.utils

This change moves the ability to enable logging out of the
examples.common module and into the openstack.utils since it is
generally useful.

This is intended to give users a short-term solution to receive
debugging messages. If they want to always have our messages logged in
their application they should create their own logging handler(s) with
their own format, and that will cause our messages to be sent to their
handlers as they wish.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-openstacksdk/+bug/1418307 is open to
track the documentation aspect of this.

Change-Id: Ic8768d529d0389b9b04bd4ea31453a82f30faf33
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Add logging functionality to openstack.utils

This change moves the ability to enable logging out of the
examples.common module and into the openstack.utils since it is
generally useful.

This is intended to give users a short-term solution to receive
debugging messages. If they want to always have our messages logged in
their application they should create their own logging handler(s) with
their own format, and that will cause our messages to be sent to their
handlers as they wish.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-openstacksdk/+bug/1418307 is open to
track the documentation aspect of this.

Change-Id: Ic8768d529d0389b9b04bd4ea31453a82f30faf33

commit_message:
Add OSTF tests for Glance component

- Added base class for Glance component in OSTF.
- Added 'Image Create, Update, Delete' and 'List Images' tests for
  Glance api v1 and Glance api v2
- Updated requirements: added python-glanceclient=>0.14.1
- Added initialization of glance_client v1 and v2 in nmanager.py

Partially implements: blueprint ostf-and-system-tests-for-glance

Change-Id: I4a2957eefb98d718e7fc25153a6b07251250f4d2

commit_message:
Add a "general" section

This is for topics which do not easily fit into specific topics but
are more about overall style or general attitude of approach.

For an initial proposal, diversity of clients seems a good
guideline.

Change-Id: I70d54a0ce98b7a583ba0b1e171b89d206acad98f

commit_message:
Bump up to the six 1.8.x series

Added new stuff:
- six.moves.shlex_quote
- six.moves.intern
- six.urllib.request.splittag
- six.urllib.request.splituse

The full changelog can be found at:
https://bitbucket.org/gutworth/six/src/fa79/CHANGES?at=1.8.0

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-12 02:18:29.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Bump six up to 1.9.0

Taskflow would like to use the 'raise_from' helper that
abstracts out python 3.x raise from syntax so that taskflow
can raise exceptions that operate better and are
formatted correctly (when chained) on python 3.x.

That release also fixes other issue(s) that affect openstack
projects (one key one being):

- Fix `six.moves` race condition in multi-threaded code.

Change-Id: I9f4d512105fe695c68b5c4d2fcd1a405fe9b8554
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Bump six up to 1.9.0

Taskflow would like to use the 'raise_from' helper that
abstracts out python 3.x raise from syntax so that taskflow
can raise exceptions that operate better and are
formatted correctly (when chained) on python 3.x.

That release also fixes other issue(s) that affect openstack
projects (one key one being):

- Fix `six.moves` race condition in multi-threaded code.

Change-Id: I9f4d512105fe695c68b5c4d2fcd1a405fe9b8554

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 3099, 'name': 'David Shrewsbury', 'email': 'dshrewsb@redhat.com', 'username': 'dshrews'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 7133, 'name': 'Ryan Moore', 'email': 'ryan.moore@hpe.com', 'username': 'moory'}, {'_account_id': 8125, 'name': 'Michael Davies', 'email': 'michael@the-davies.net', 'username': 'mrda'}, {'_account_id': 8688, 'name': 'Alexis Lee', 'email': 'openstack@lxsli.co.uk', 'username': 'lxsli'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10373, 'name': 'Nicholas Randon', 'email': 'nicholas.randon@hp.com', 'username': 'randonn'}, {'_account_id': 12081, 'name': 'IBM xCAT CI', 'email': 'xcat@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-xcat-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12356, 'name': 'Vladyslav Drok', 'email': 'vdrok@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vdrok'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-12 19:42:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Correctly rebuild the PXE file during takeover of ACTIVE nodes

During a conductor take-over, eg. from another failed conductor, it
rebuilds the PXE configuration of nodes that are mapped to it. This
calls node.driver.deploy.prepare(). However, in the PXE driver,
prepare() was not properly handling the case where it was called on a
node with an ACTIVE deploy state.

In such a situation, prepare() needs to switch from the "deploy" config
to the "boot" config.  Furthermore, the PXE boot file must specify the
node's root disk UUID.  This was previously not available outside of the
_continue_deploy() method, and so is now saved on
node.driver_internal_info when the initial deploy is completed.

Change-Id: I6adc65b756e22c5c78d30231187fe2e8ccf2594d
Closes-bug: #1421370
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-02-12 22:32:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Correctly rebuild the PXE file during takeover of ACTIVE nodes

calls node.driver.deploy.prepare(). However, in the PXE driver,
prepare() was not properly handling the case where it was called on a
node with an ACTIVE deploy state.

In such a situation, prepare() needs to switch from the "deploy" config
to the "boot" config.  Furthermore, the PXE boot file must specify the
node's root disk UUID.  This was previously not available outside of the
_continue_deploy() method, and so is now saved on
node.driver_internal_info when the initial deploy is completed.

commit_message:
Correctly rebuild the PXE file during takeover of ACTIVE nodes

During a conductor take-over, eg. from another failed conductor, it
rebuilds the PXE configuration of nodes that are mapped to it. This
calls node.driver.deploy.prepare(). However, in the PXE driver,
prepare() was not properly handling the case where it was called on a
node with an ACTIVE deploy state.

In such a situation, prepare() needs to switch from the "deploy" config
to the "boot" config.  Furthermore, the PXE boot file must specify the
node's root disk UUID.  This was previously not available outside of the
_continue_deploy() method, and so is now saved on
node.driver_internal_info when the initial deploy is completed.

Co-Authored-By: David Shrewsbury <shrewsbury.dave@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6adc65b756e22c5c78d30231187fe2e8ccf2594d
Closes-bug: #1421370

commit_message:
fix missing TOP_DIR which can break sourcing

There were a couple of places where TOP_DIR is missing when we do a
source of content in tools. Given that working directory can change
quite often during devstack, we need to always be explicit here.

Change-Id: I14b5699637d7f5db745bccf116f440cdcbaa8d91

commit_message:
Rename checks to fixture and update requirements

This renamed the "checks" module to be in line with other oslo libraries,
and adds fixtures and mock to the list of requirements, since they are
required for actual library code.

Change-Id: I782762d5cd4166893593e172f49fda8ab35e478d

subject: Sync default-setting change from Nova
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-19 21:00:40.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/base.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_objects.py'], 'message': 'Sync default-setting change from Nova

Make obj_set_defaults() more useful

This makes obj_set_defaults() not overwrite existing values set on the object
with the default. The idea of obj_set_defaults() is to allow filling in fields
with default values if they are otherwise unknown. Before this patch, the
following code would not work, but does after:

 obj = MyObject(foo=123)
 obj.obj_set_defaults()
 # obj.foo would be overwritten with the default

Change-Id: Id5cfae6bc6a488ff6fab162b3d12a7412094e28e
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Sync default-setting change from Nova

Make obj_set_defaults() more useful

This makes obj_set_defaults() not overwrite existing values set on the object
with the default. The idea of obj_set_defaults() is to allow filling in fields
with default values if they are otherwise unknown. Before this patch, the
following code would not work, but does after:

 obj = MyObject(foo=123)
 obj.obj_set_defaults()
 # obj.foo would be overwritten with the default

Change-Id: Id5cfae6bc6a488ff6fab162b3d12a7412094e28e

commit_message:
Fix configuration of Ceph-related compute options

Previously we would only configure certain Ceph-related
compute options when Ceph was used as a backend for Glance.
Using Ceph for ephemeral volumes but not for images would
result in a Puppet error. Using Ceph for volumes but not
for images would result in a sub-optimal configuration.

Change-Id: I49e83b056380b2591ade0cdb0af668f3508745d1
Closes-bug: #1405407

subject: Sync obj_reset_changes(recursive=) change from Nova
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-19 21:00:40.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/base.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Sync obj_reset_changes(recursive=) change from Nova

Add recursive flag to obj_reset_changes()

This makes recursive resets work on sub-objects, when requested. Note that
because obj_reset_changes() was shadowing the fields import, we needed to
disambiguate one of the two in order to check against fields. Since fields is
a part of that method's API, I decided to change the import, which had a bunch
of fallout changes that aren't completely related, but necessary.

Change-Id: I5beb7d86fbcee712bb3c3b791b5ab37d90441d2a
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Sync obj_reset_changes(recursive=) change from Nova

Add recursive flag to obj_reset_changes()

This makes recursive resets work on sub-objects, when requested. Note that
because obj_reset_changes() was shadowing the fields import, we needed to
disambiguate one of the two in order to check against fields. Since fields is
a part of that method's API, I decided to change the import, which had a bunch
of fallout changes that aren't completely related, but necessary.

Change-Id: I5beb7d86fbcee712bb3c3b791b5ab37d90441d2a

commit_message:
Fix deprecated options in MySQL config

The "key_buffer_size" option has replaced the old "key_buffer".
Additionally set explicit TIMESTAMP values.

Change-Id: Iaa2aa6d3d68003c669fbef849acd892f6f40b393
Closes-Bug: 1405098

commit_message:
Add x509_sign provider to openssl module.

It adds the x509_sign provider in order to be able to sign a CSR. It
adds two parameters that are: infile and template that is the config
file. Private key used by the CA to sign the certificate is passed
using the configuration file. You can use it as follow:

  x509_sign { "/tmp/signed_req.pem":
      ensure   => present,
      template => "/tmp/ca_openssl.cnf",
      infile   => "/tmp/user_req_cert.pem"
  }

Change-Id: I9be9df731be3bf64333eff366aaf9eb27a27b72d
Implements: blueprint ssl-endpoints

commit_message:
Generalize the object relationships test

This adds a test_relationships_in_order() checker task that allows projects
to scan their object repositories and ensure that relationships between
objects are in order and consistent.

Change-Id: I71cdeb5786b8ea927823e1fbbadb374149c7708c

X.0 and X.Y, obj.obj_make_compatible(target_version=version) works (i.e.

Change-Id: I01efbf45d8df385bd245bee0c3cedc780fd4cd97
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Generalize compatibility testing

This makes the test_obj_make_compatible() into a generalized thing that
scans the object repository and makes sure that, for every version between
X.0 and X.Y, obj.obj_make_compatible(target_version=version) works (i.e.
doesn't raise an exception).

Change-Id: I01efbf45d8df385bd245bee0c3cedc780fd4cd97

   opening brace, e.g. "\{text}"

commit_message:
Fix ubuntu_service_override ordering

Fixes resource ordering in tweaks::ubuntu_service_override to make
sure we do not leave any 'override' files.
Replaces tabs with spaces in ubuntu_service_override.pp
Added tweaks::ubuntu_service_override for cinder-volume in
openstack::cinder class.

Change-Id: I036cb65153029bb1a09be5eea2ee5bb4cbe97ae9
Closes-bug: #1421595
(cherry picked from commit 8994a8ad5e9767f1a7f84cf95b387e71bb39c6cf)

commit_message:
Update cinder $manage_volume condition for cinder VMDK

$manage_volume condition was improperly checking for the cinder role to
 deploy cinder-volume to. We need to deploy cinder-volume the same way
 as we do for ceph

add host param to cinder backend vmkd as it happens is
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/157004/

Change-Id: I9f615b88f6d22a902ed93f7a6e1eb84803991b34
Closes-Bug: 1410517

commit_message:
Use haproxy's http-server-close by default

At load, haproxy begins accumulating a large number of connections to
backend services stuck in TIME_WAIT state. Eventually, this leads to
stalled requests to OpenStack API services. http-server-close solves
that problem.


Change-Id: Ie405fe2d384d9d8375f60ad2c3c9885f41fe6d49
Closes-Bug: 1413104
(cherry picked from commit 6c6bfc35f779774141274579b948280518f57e2d)
(cherry picked from commit a8417ef811919dbe7abee90eeb67f4ca7ede2935)

commit_message:
Move metric capabilities into a single Resource

Previously, one call to /capabilities would result in potentially
several Capability objects being returned (through `list`),
and you had to check the value to know what type of capability
it was. This change brings that all together in one object and
sets the type of capabiltiy returned as a property on the object.

It now works like this:

>>> from openstack.metric.v1 import capabilities
>>> caps = capabilities.Capabilities().get(session)
>>> caps.aggregation_methods
['mean', 'max', 'avg']

Change-Id: Icee03330d42df8aeea11863eef7e4721d8311156

commit_message:
Retry installing apt packages by default

There are a number of tasks used to install apt packages. Some of the
tasks will retry on failure and others will not. These tasks are
susceptible to failure and so it makes sense that they retry if the
task fails.

This commit updates the apt tasks so that they all retry with the
default retries and delay values of 3 and 5 respectively. In addition
all the tasks will attempt to update the cache if it is older than
600 seconds.

Some of the apt tasks had the state set to latest, this has been
changed to present because upgrades should be handled by specific
upgrade tasks.

Closes-Bug: #1421238
Change-Id: I8c20c5c0a2ce87706a99734adcdf55c93efb405c

commit_message:
Fix security group setup when users_per_tenant is > 1

If there is more than one user per tenant, utils.iterate_per_tenants()
will handle only one user per tenant, leaving the others without
their secgroup context being setup. So instead we have to iterate
over all users.

The unit test was hiding this fault by using the users context
duplicated by "*2", making both copies being updated simultaneously.

Change-Id: Iea8624b272e422575cb7d297d4ff440f64a7b679
Closes-Bug: 1423607

commit_message:
Do not show topology page for the new environment

If environment is empty, topology tab doesn't make sense.
This fix hiding it in that case.

Change-Id: Id25f04ed77a15fdb730af3f719d8ad1c5a9401c7

commit_message:
Update guest VM OS recommendation in SAIO doc

The target development platform has changed to Ubuntu 14.04 [1].
This patch makes the suggested SAIO platform the same.

Also, remove pointer to wiki page for other platform install
instructions that either redirects back to this SAIO doc or
to another wike page and then a dead link.

[1] I0a96bcf692bb240f3ab5aab7fefd294a07735a83

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9f96104b5437c1f1f28f924c048ef83cf03338f4

commit_message:
Increase py26 timeouts for nova-stable

Seeing repeated timeouts on the current 40 minute limit for jobs
on nova for stable juno.  Increasing to 60.

Change-Id: I8f26714d696928b899b81cb5c2703f00e2185a96

commit_message:
Use oslo.i18n for translation

Remove gettextutils in favor of oslo.i18n suite for
internationalization purposes. Wrap murano.common.i18n around
oslo.i18n. Mark all logs messages of levels higher than
DEBUG for translation with _/_LI/_LW/_LE/_LC to conform with
oslo.i18n guidelines.

Change-Id: I09a2e2fc802e404f5c59fa4edd2a2124ad24101a
Implements: blueprint organize-translation

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-04 13:24:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Unify logic that determines liveliness of DHCP agent

For DHCP agents sometimes it's not enough to check agent's last heartbeat
time because in its starting period the agent may fail to send state reports
because it's busy processing networks.
In rescheduling logic such DHCP agent is given additional time after start.
Additional time is proportional to amount of networks the agent is hosting.
Need to apply the same logic to DHCP agent scheduler to avoid a case
when starting agent is considered dead and a network gets more hosting
agents than configured.

Change-Id: I0fe6244c7d2ed42e4744351be34f251318322c54
Closes-Bug: #1417708

commit_message:
Unify logic that determines liveliness of DHCP agent

For DHCP agents sometimes it's not enough to check agent's last heartbeat
time because in its starting period the agent may fail to send state reports
because it's busy processing networks.
In rescheduling logic such DHCP agent is given additional time after start.
Additional time is proportional to amount of networks the agent is hosting.
Need to apply the same logic to DHCP agent scheduler to avoid a case
when starting agent is considered dead and a network gets more hosting
agents than configured.

Change-Id: I0fe6244c7d2ed42e4744351be34f251318322c54
Closes-Bug: #1417708

commit_message:
Data which evaluates to 'False' is now properly passed to context

Fixes a bug when the data being passed into the expression context was not
properly checked for being not-None which was causing the empty lists/dicts
or False booleans to be omitted from the context.

Change-Id: I56875f0847169ab8ed0fc29ea1400a1fa4ca2c2a

commit_message:
Restore CLI entry point and version in setup.cfg

During project toxification (commit c96200f) setup.py was modified
according to OpenStack standards and the entry_point and version
info were removed from it.
However, appropriate sections were not added into setup.cfg.
This commit puts them there, so CLI and package versioning works
properly again.

Change-Id: I1e2ed6513b4e4cd8d3dcc774fd456833dc7c79d5

commit_message:
Added retries in 'network_set_host' function

In concurrent transactions in 'network_set_host' function
could happen a deadlock or returned rows_updated value
could be equal to 0.

In these cases we should retry the transaction to get
another row and try to set the host again.

Closes-Bug: #1422610

Change-Id: I374b12e62f76810ffdb1e2d35af72a738ead5591

commit_message:
Split out BootstrapNode SoftwareConfig

This patch splits out the BootstrapNode config
such that alternate implementation (puppet for example)
can implement their own SoftwareConfig's via a nested stack.

This is controlled by the standard overcloud heat environment.

For os-apply-config deployments the implementation should work the
same as before.

For puppet deployments the implementation uses hiera metadata
to configure bootstrap_nodeid.

Change-Id: I691a9d7c474866038a5d47beab295899b5479d03

commit_message:
Change defaults test_sets in OSTF test.

Because simple mode is transferred to experimental status,
change the default values for OSTF tests. For compatibility
with existing code checks to  see, if mode is used
without HA, and in tests it is listed, then remove the
ha-tests.

Change-Id: Iff796e879b51686602ad182cdd1e5ccd23dd4403

The "splice-auto" options causes HAProxy to evaluate splice() system

responses. The possible gain of splicing depends on too many factors and

commit_message:
Let HAProxy determine usefulness of TCP splicing

The "splice-auto" options causes HAProxy to evaluate splice() system
call performance using light heuristic, independently for requests and
responses. The possible gain of splicing depends on too many factors and
might be dependent on used hardware so there is no point in hardcoding
it.

Change-Id: I06e106eaacf9c67a9ef1582a37b5c46209fb0c2b
Closes-Bug: 1420710
(cherry picked from commit ea938a425423ec68174e10ef6de4c2fa4429304c)

commit_message:
Make "enabled" colume values display-friendly and consistent

Most boolean columes are displayed through yesno_filter
and capfirst_filter, but the changed field were not.

In addition, by using yesno_filter, the corresponding colums
are displayed with translated strings and it fixes I18N bug
at the same time.

The following columes are updated by this patch.

Identity -> Domains (enabled)
Identity -> Users (enabled)
Identity -> Groups (enabled)
Firewall -> Rules (enabled, audited)

Change-Id: I35eeed6addc8f58faa34bc990c758523e4830960
Closes-Bug: #1422074

commit_message:
Remove deprecated property of router_interface

Old property SUBNET_ID is not used in current code and may be deleted.
The resolving function was changed to support only one key in property
schema.

Change-Id: Id5057e6051e721616df4dc6496a6202372645db8

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-17 22:32:05.000000000', 'files': ['hot/software-config/elements/heat-config/bin/heat-config-notify', 'tests/software_config/test_heat_config_notify.py'], 'message': 'heat-config-notify support deploy_signal_verb

The URL for deploy_signal_id is called with POST by default, however some
signals need to be called with PUT (specifically signals backed by swift
objects).

This change uses the value of deploy_signal_verb for POST or PUT, using

Change-Id: I8c83fa34cad9b1e91abcfc7e26e04b21cdc9bde4
Partial-Blueprint: software-config-swift-signal
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
heat-config-notify support deploy_signal_verb

The URL for deploy_signal_id is called with POST by default, however some
signals need to be called with PUT (specifically signals backed by swift
objects).

This change uses the value of deploy_signal_verb for POST or PUT, using
POST by default.

Change-Id: I8c83fa34cad9b1e91abcfc7e26e04b21cdc9bde4
Partial-Blueprint: software-config-swift-signal

commit_message:
Mock link local allocator write so UT doesn't write a file

The UTs recently started writing a fip-linklocal-networks file in
test_l3_agent.  This is due to a recently added test.  This patch adds
a mock to it so that the file is not written.

Change-Id: I338a369fe25e64faa84cdec413d6bad7b315f890

commit_message:
libvirt: Adjust Nova to support FCP on System z systems

There are some platform specific changes needed to allow Nova to support
System z: the System z specific format of the device file paths, adding
and removing devices explicitely, and ignoring vHBAs which are offline.

Partial-Implements blueprint libvirt-kvm-systemz

Change-Id: Ica4938d9962bbb402e26dd47f0aea502ea0c4245

commit_message:
Snapshot of bootable volume goes in error state

If volume is not created from image, no glance
metadata would be available for that volume/snapshot
in volume glance metadata table. So simply catch
GlanceMetadataNotFound and do nothing.

Closes-Bug: #1413880
Change-Id: Ic3267d422912f94e966412859e2b8bddeddfb75f

commit_message:
Moved keystone settings in the ceilometer collector

Removed _connect abstract method as we can't assume the collector will
connect somewhere and should be handled by the collector himself.
Removed now useless state manager in orchestrator(handled by the storage
backend).
Kept the keystone instance in the orchestrator for future token
validation purpose.

Change-Id: I471ed1ad94345c83a637247d814a30b38743b100

We need to fix this before moving to >=1.6.0.

commit_message:
Move auth_token into its own folder

In preparation for splitting auth_token into files we move everything
into its own folder and verify that it still works, and establish a
separate testing directory.

Change-Id: I4f3aad706e2e9fa1b984b022858adabb552258e2
Implements: bp refactor-extract-module

commit_message:
Add name and tenant indexes to stack table

This change adds indexes to the name and tenant columns of the stack
table, to improve query performance.

Change-Id: I0c675bda1b27814c4a7e9fce6c78af48266b5258
Closes-Bug: #1421885

patch adds new lib to projects.

commit_message:
Be explicit about using /tmp for temporary datafiles

If TMPDIR is not set, different version of mktemp will behave
differently. To be sure, best to be explicit.

Change-Id: Id92eb4e5b833a1c0859a0c6d68cfc2f4e1f6977f

subject: Make the dispatcher handler be an actual type
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-16 04:05:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make the dispatcher handler be an actual type

Instead of having the dispatcher target be a tuple
or a single callback, have it be an actual type with
comments as to what the types fields are and how they
are used.

This makes it more obvious as to what those fields are
and how they are used so that it is easier to understand
how the WBE engine and components work.

Change-Id: I5541ccd5a7aa6ae73ed9adceeac2c0524e2a1dc9
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-02-16 04:13:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make the dispatcher handler be an actual type

or a single callback, have it be an actual type with
comments as to what the types fields are and how they
are used.

This makes it more obvious as to what those fields are
and how they are used so that it is easier to understand

commit_message:
Make the dispatcher handler be an actual type

Instead of having the dispatcher target be a tuple
or a single callback, have it be an actual type with
comments as to what the types fields are and how they
are used.

This makes it more obvious as to what those fields are
and how they are used so that it is easier to understand
how the WBE engine and components work.

Change-Id: I5541ccd5a7aa6ae73ed9adceeac2c0524e2a1dc9

commit_message:
Email notifier returns false if self._smtp == None

When an email notifier is created and the initial smtp connection fails the
self._smtp variable is left set to None.  Now we detect that and try to
reconnect.

Change-Id: Ifbc30ee5339722357d86214b4d8c84e64dd703f7

commit_message:
Allow the periodic worker to take a periodic object(s)

Instead of having the periodic worker only take decorated
functions/methods allow it to take a new immutable object that
has the same information as the decorated method/functions (and
that object is now used internally to the worker) so that it is
easier to dynamically create periodic callables (without having
to create mini-methods that are decorated to work around this
limitation).

Change-Id: Icbaf0c321de91dee46a7bf44449ac5b94f86fdeb

commit_message:
Implement refresh as kwargs in get_volume_stats

When implementing the base driver "get_volume_stats" function, not all
drivers implemented 'refresh' as a kwarg. This can cause failures for any
code that simply invokes the following (assuming that refresh will default
to False -- which is does for 50+ drivers):

    driver.get_volume_stats()

This patch set updates the 7 drivers that did not implement refresh as a
kwarg so that the various driver implementations are consistent.

Closes-bug: 1423357
Change-Id: I6520155d1cbde4bf41573c170f4ea81815b5c1c2

commit_message:
Sort event-list by oldest first

Since event-list is log-like, it would be *much* friendlier
to users to sort by oldest first, especially for large
stacks where the events scroll.

This change adds sort_dir=asc to the event list query for
the CLI event-list command only.

Change-Id: I479e9ec36bf14a5f250348ca4279c508da23c2a2
Closes-Bug: #1420091

commit_message:
Provide additional detail if OAuth headers are missing

If WSGIPassAuthorization is not set correctly, the user gets back
an obscure message, since the code continues and tries to get
values from a None object.

This change brings a proper exception for this configuration issue
and lets the user know what to fix.

Closes-Bug: #1420121

Change-Id: Iee282383a67ec13b5bfb5267fe9d81124c5e289d

subject: Allow Resource attributes to be updated
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-17 02:07:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow Resource attributes to be updated

With Resource being a MutableMapping, it inherits an `update` method
like any mapping does. In the Connection layer, this would be really
useful when we want to be able to update properties on a Resource
based on dictionaries or named arguments users are calling proxy
methods with. However, since we override `update` to do our own idea
of updating, we lose that.

A specific example of where this is useful is that
object_store.set_*_metadata would work great if it could take named
arguments and set them on a resource, and then call `update`. The
following pseudocode explains:

    def set_metadata(container, **metadata):
        container.update_attrs(metadata)
        ...

    set_metadata(c, read_ACL="foo", write_ACL="bar")

This would result in those resource.props being set on the `c`, whereas
today we would have to look into the **metadata keys and values and send
them through setattr.

Change-Id: I1f7d71e7874ad39c353e299e3d4aac11c5e229e8

commit_message:
Allow Resource attributes to be updated

With Resource being a MutableMapping, it inherits an `update` method
like any mapping does. In the Connection layer, this would be really
useful when we want to be able to update properties on a Resource
based on dictionaries or named arguments users are calling proxy
methods with. However, since we override `update` to do our own idea
of updating, we lose that.

A specific example of where this is useful is that
object_store.set_*_metadata would work great if it could take named
arguments and set them on a resource, and then call `update`. The
following pseudocode explains:

    def set_metadata(container, **metadata):
        container.update_attrs(metadata)
        ...

    set_metadata(c, read_ACL="foo", write_ACL="bar")

This would result in those resource.props being set on the `c`, whereas
today we would have to look into the **metadata keys and values and send
them through setattr.

Change-Id: I1f7d71e7874ad39c353e299e3d4aac11c5e229e8

subject: Mutate Resource via mapping instead of dict
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-17 06:46:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Mutate Resource via mapping instead of dict

resource.prop was doing all of its mutation of the parent Resource via
instance._attrs, i.e., directly modifying the attributes and working
around the MutableMapping magic methods where we've handled things like
the dirty list, which we then look at when doing calls like
Resource.update. Because we're bypassing that, we're not properly
sending the correct values in update calls for attributes that were
modified via their prop.

If we make resource.prop do its get/set/delete on the Resource instance
and let the Resource instance work with the underlying dictionary, the
dirty list is kept accurate regardless of how attributes were modified,
whether it's through creation of the object, prop update, or mapping
update.

Change-Id: I977ce898a4a7b8718d7d6a29470d51ab8a5dd674
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-02-19 15:59:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Mutate Resource via mapping instead of dict

commit_message:
Mutate Resource via mapping instead of dict

resource.prop was doing all of its mutation of the parent Resource via
instance._attrs, i.e., directly modifying the attributes and working
around the MutableMapping magic methods where we've handled things like
the dirty list, which we then look at when doing calls like
Resource.update. Because we're bypassing that, we're not properly
sending the correct values in update calls for attributes that were
modified via their prop.

If we make resource.prop do its get/set/delete on the Resource instance
and let the Resource instance work with the underlying dictionary, the
dirty list is kept accurate regardless of how attributes were modified,
whether it's through creation of the object, prop update, or mapping
update.

Change-Id: I977ce898a4a7b8718d7d6a29470d51ab8a5dd674

commit_message:
Add Rules.from_dict classmethod

Many services currently construct a Rules instance from a dictionary in
their tests. It would be beneficial to them if they didn't have to
import oslo_policy._parser in order to parse a rule before passing it to
Rules.__init__. Adding a Rules.from_dict classmethod should satisfy the
need to create a Rules instance from a dictionary in tests.

Change-Id: I3d73059277c45d4852f842474c6f1d61daa349b8

Previously we were using assertEqual(True, expected) or

Change-Id: I05747a13533be00f7adc827276b833ae6aefd725
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use assertTrue or assertFalse where appropriate

Previously we were using assertEqual(True, expected) or
assertEqual(False, exepected) instead of assertTrue or assertFalse
respectively. This simply updates the existing tests to follow the
common practice in oslo and OpenStack.

Change-Id: I05747a13533be00f7adc827276b833ae6aefd725

commit_message:
Fix the order of args to assertEqual in tests

The order of parameters needs to be (expected, actual) and many of the
tests in test_checks, test_parser, and test_policy were not following
that convention.

Closes-bug: 1277104
Change-Id: I2259972de4961bf9d5f9c6742d81eb083b770fba

commit_message:
Block novaclient 2.21

There is a bash completion bug in novaclient 2.21
which is causing nova volume-attach to fail so we
need to ban this release as it's also blowing
up gate jobs.

Change-Id: I8bebf3cf444522d66e1d4ac322642a1eea9e8441
Related-Bug: #1423695

commit_message:
Remove error logs for a common situation (non created ipsets)

The log message was initially added by me as part of a
iptables_firewall refactor.

Ipsets for empty IP address lists aren't currently created,
that means that we can't reference empty security groups
(as ipsets) via iptable rules, and that's a normal condition,
not an error.

Closes bug: #1421772
Change-Id: I6b1ae1fb505ce5e76ef8cf7ef7df38cff57e0000

commit_message:
Base launch instance wizard

- Setting up base launch instance wizard to enable parallel
  development on steps in the work flow.
- Adding business logic related code to openstack_dashboard
  project.
- Using Horizon's well-defined plug-in architecture to hook
  launch instance to Horizon.

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign
Change-Id: Ibbbbfc7f49c58a78b0d1b29e363531d5ae1a9aab

commit_message:
added dynamic cluster create flow

- added create_cluster_node flow factory function for creating a
  cluster node
- modified create_cluster flow factory function to call
  create_cluster_node for each cluster node
- modified neutron and nova fixtures to support testing for
  cluster create flow

Change-Id: I92aae38d71baeca9a84385813180703bbb9c2ece

Prior to this change, it was difficult for us to identify which files

made it impossible to write log rotation policies which apply only to

commit_message:
Put Openstack service logs into tripleo directory

Prior to this change, it was difficult for us to identify which files
under /var/log came from openstack services. Amongst other things, this
made it impossible to write log rotation policies which apply only to
the Openstack service logs.

This change moves the logs into their own directory, /var/log/tripleo

It's now easy for logrotate to apply special handling to these log files
without having to touch the system log rotate rules.

Change-Id: I8439ce29dd8a0dc8f68fbb1acee73ebdc07f9c25

Supress warning in cli methods that have sensetive output

All commands that have special output format (json, yaml, csv,
...) shouldn't print any warnings

remove import of deprecated novaclient.v1_1

Closes-bug: #1423696

commit_message:
Stop making devstack-dsvm-cells voting

devstack-dsvm-cells is broken, and blocking everything. We actually have
two jobs devstack-dsvm-cells and tempest-dsvm-cells.

Make devstack-dsvm-cells  non-voting to unwedge thing. Next step is to
re-evaluate running this job at all.

Remove gate-devstck-dsvm-cells jobs as we don't run non-voting gate
jobs.

Related-Bug: #1423695

Change-Id: Ieb8e5924e71a0bf68837258f2da49918a1285adc

commit_message:
Skip volume devstack exercise

devstack-dsvm-cells runs the exercises and is gating. And the volume
exercise is currently broken. Skip it until we can fix it so we don't
block projects that gate on this job.

Change-Id: Iff14b8dae01add104945ae6ab4b7439814901c21
Related-Bug: #1423695

Blacklost novaclient 2.21.0

novaclient 2.21.0 has bug in in breaking volume attach. A fix is being
worked on, but we should blacklist the bad release as well.

commit_message:
Add concept of stable states to the state machine

Adding the concept of a 'stable' state.  When using add_state() only a
'stable' state can be used as a target.

Change-Id: I22ec4f4cbb855849e9a80b6a32ed01d1616958da

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-25 21:58:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Move eventlet server options to a config section

Keystone can run in an eventlet server (keystone-all), or it can
run in a WSGI container (Apache Httpd). There are several
configuration options that are only used to configure the eventlet
server and are ignored when running in a WSGI container. Having
all the eventlet server options in the default section makes it
difficult for deployers to know what can be ignored when running
in WSGI mode. The options that are only used by the eventlet
server are moved into an [eventlet_server] section, and the SSL
options are moved into [eventlet_server_xml].

DocImpact

Change-Id: I6dd718c4d54056d0e29978f393ec45f7291f802d

commit_message:
Move eventlet server options to a config section

Keystone can run in an eventlet server (keystone-all), or it can
run in a WSGI container (Apache Httpd). There are several
configuration options that are only used to configure the eventlet
server and are ignored when running in a WSGI container. Having
all the eventlet server options in the default section makes it
difficult for deployers to know what can be ignored when running
in WSGI mode. The options that are only used by the eventlet
server are moved into an [eventlet_server] section, and the SSL
options are moved into [eventlet_server_ssl].

bp eventlet-server-config

Change-Id: I6dd718c4d54056d0e29978f393ec45f7291f802d

commit_message:
Add documentation of DIB_IMAGE_CACHE variable

It is an established convention to use DIB_IMAGE_CACHE in elements to
refer to the cache location. This convention has not been documented
in the README, unlike other element development practices. This change
adds documentation for DIB_IMAGE_CACHE both from an element user and
developer perspective.

This change was prompted by I76030654e7dfc7b7d4dfa87e082c14e7cee479b9

Change-Id: I6fcc2409450cdb45e5afcb292908fbaee1af258a

Heat is provided in default devstack installations, and isn't required
in local.conf any more.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Heat/GettingStartedUsingDevstack#Heat_and_Devstack

Change-Id: I6bbb9a4cf16f6a859b83dbad79d07f022c93c5e1

commit_message:
Switch to using oslo.log from library

This commit switches to using the oslo.log library instead of the
locally synced version from oslo-incubator. Also, since Tempest-lib
doesn't actually use oslo.config for anything except oslo.log now
that we're using it as an external lib let's remove oslo.config from
the requirements file.

Change-Id: Ia4f12b747643637d93bf6873563b6c34924c5bb0

commit_message:
Improve robustness of network failover

In some cases when remove_network_from_dhcp_agent is called
concurrently by more than one neutron server it leads to unexpected
DB exception when NetworkDhcpAgentBinding is removed.
Need to avoid such case and make remove_networks_from_down_agents
method resistant to such issues by catching broad exception.

Change-Id: I653e200d89eb795ded742bb49420f09f66625587
Closes-Bug: #1417629

commit_message:
Provide independent disk size from image

The image should only specify the size of the image.  The backing disk
may be independent of this.  For instance a 5 GB image put on to a 20 GB
disk.

This change set allows for that independence in the specification.  Will
create the disk based on the overall requirements from the flavor.

Adds a change to the localdisk.py to support this.

Minor MTMS fix for the available nodes in the driver.

Change-Id: I16cd312acf2d7cf395c55f5cfae0bddaf991a6a9

commit_message:
Do not use urllib3 from requests

glanceclient is using the embedded version of urllib3 from
requests, which is removed from Debian (and Ubuntu), so
everything is failing over. This patch restores sanity.

Change-Id: Id6766e99cc522a21581c282739dc4f9c1840986f

subject: Fix mock import in Python 3.2
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-17 14:42:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix mock import in Python 3.2

The "from six.moves import mock" just fails in Python 3.2,
which is in Wheezy. This patch adds an except: statement,
which does the import in the old style, before commit
4fc793fce5a59feb8beab59178480414a4e1db25 changed it.

The Debian package which I maintain uses this patch already,
and it works in both Python 3.2 and 3.4. Please accept it
upstream, as I don't think it may hurt.

Change-Id: Id93c26240ae2951a4bbd2cf7900d85a49a7b20d6
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-09-17 15:38:41.000000000', 'files': ['oslotest/mockpatch.py', 'tests/unit/test_mockpatch.py', 'oslotest/base.py', 'tests/unit/test_base.py'], 'message': 'Fix mock import in Python 3.2

The "from six.moves import mock" just fails in Python 3.2,
which is in Wheezy. This patch adds an except: statement,
which does the import in the old style, before commit
4fc793fce5a59feb8beab59178480414a4e1db25 changed it.

The Debian package which I maintain uses this patch already,
and it works in both Python 3.2 and 3.4. Please accept it
upstream, as I don't think it may hurt.

Change-Id: Id93c26240ae2951a4bbd2cf7900d85a49a7b20d6
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix mock import in Python 3.2

The "from six.moves import mock" just fails in Python 3.2,
which is in Wheezy. This patch adds an except: statement,
which does the import in the old style, before commit
4fc793fce5a59feb8beab59178480414a4e1db25 changed it.

The Debian package which I maintain uses this patch already,
and it works in both Python 3.2 and 3.4. Please accept it
upstream, as I don't think it may hurt.

Change-Id: Id93c26240ae2951a4bbd2cf7900d85a49a7b20d6

commit_message:
Add documentation for the IPMI retry timeout option

It is difficult to have a universal default for the retry_timeout
option in the [impi] configuration section. This patch adds
documentation of the tradeoffs involved, while leaving the
conservative default in place.

Closes-Bug: 1383432
Change-Id: Ic7973cf7fee60cc817e5c0f5f9bfc84b3bca91c7

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-22 10:19:10.000000000', 'files': ['os_apply_config/tests/test_apply_config.py', 'os_apply_config/apply_config.py'], 'message': 'Print JSON-compatible booleans

Given os-apply-config takes a JSON file as input and prints JSON-style
strings not Python ones, Booleans present an anomaly.

These are printed using `str(config)`, resulting in "True" and "False"
rather than the lowercase and JSON-compatible "true" and "false". This
patch corrects this.

There is some risk of breaking users but it should be trivial for them
to fix their scripts. As I write this, o-a-c is at 0.1.28, so we're
allowed breaking changes and I believe this is the last change required
to make all output JSON-compatible.

Change-Id: Ib41d3b01656fc7afc4911fd78ba7c1116aa9b1c9
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Print JSON-compatible booleans

Given os-apply-config takes a JSON file as input and prints JSON-style
strings not Python ones, Booleans present an anomaly.

These are printed using `str(config)`, resulting in "True" and "False"
rather than the lowercase and JSON-compatible "true" and "false". This
patch corrects this.

There is some risk of breaking users but it should be trivial for them
to fix their scripts. As I write this, o-a-c is at 0.1.28, so we're
allowed breaking changes and I believe this is the last change required
to make all output JSON-compatible.

Change-Id: Ib41d3b01656fc7afc4911fd78ba7c1116aa9b1c9

commit_message:
Check VMware session before uploading image

Uploading an image to vSphere backend without checking the session
results in broken pipe socket error. When this happens, glance-api
sends a 400 response because the IOError is not handled by the
store.

We address this issue by :-
1. Checking if session is authenticated before uploading the image.
2. Handle IOError and check the response code.

Closes-Bug: #1402354

Change-Id: I66b6dfddfb2ddd089488f3f79f3917fd69739fc9

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-30 08:03:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add non-voting job for Nova V2.1 API with neutron

'tempest-dsvm-nova-v21-full' job tests Nova V2.1 API with nova-network.
It runs all tempest nova v2 tests by changing the API endpoint from V2
to v2.1

There are many tests in Tempest which runs with neutron only and interact
with nova also for server request etc. Some of those tests fails when
running those against V2.1 due to strong input validation.
ex- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151117/

So it is important to test Nova V2.1 API with neutron to keep
API stability for nova-network as well as with neutron.

This patch adds a new non-voting job to run tempest nova tests
with Nova V2.1 and neutron.

Change-Id: I8aa6f79e9349c1cae1307a687c9c0dfca0508f7f

commit_message:
Add non-voting job for Nova V2.1 API with neutron

'tempest-dsvm-nova-v21-full' job tests Nova V2.1 API with nova-network.
It runs all tempest nova v2 tests by changing the API endpoint from V2
to v2.1

There are many tests in Tempest which runs with neutron only and interact
with nova also for server request etc. Some of those tests fails when
running those against V2.1 due to strong input validation.
ex- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151117/

So it is important to test Nova V2.1 API with neutron to keep
API stability for nova-network as well as with neutron.

This job will gets triggered on specific below changes only
-/nova/network/neutronv2
-/nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/
-/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/v3/
-/tempest/api/network

This patch adds a new non-voting job to run tempest tests
for above mentioned changes with Nova v2.1 and neutron.

Change-Id: I8aa6f79e9349c1cae1307a687c9c0dfca0508f7f

commit_message:
Remove check job from tripleo-puppet-elements

This removes the check-tripleo-ironic-overcloud-precise-ha
from tripleo-puppet-elements changes. This should save us
some resources because this check job doesn't provided
any coverage on tripleo-puppet-elements.

Change-Id: I182305d2841fa3ce568216019dc5059a49a75186

commit_message:
Ceph should come from supermarket

ceph 0.8.0 was tagged in supermarket, cleanup to use normal
supermarket berks path.

Change-Id: I40e91646bf07a542c3d1b02f1bf6780c96bc0fe4

commit_message:
modify events sql schema to reduce empty columns

in current design, three columns in Trait table are always empty.
this adds size to each row. since we are already checking for type
of value, we should just drop the items into their own tables.

this patch:
- moves trait table to four smaller tables similar to metadata
- does not map traits to dict-like attribute in events model as
  query performance is horrible.
- bulk inserts traits

this patch aims to improve write performance.

Closes-Bug: #1381736
Change-Id: I2bd4c16b57fe2c1ad67646ccd4417078f0f0f734

commit_message:
Updates training guides jobs

The training jobs get reorganized completely:
* XML files will only be run on Icehouse branch, master branch will go
  to RST files and generate slides (PDF, html).
* Stop translating the project.
* Add slides jobs that only runs on master and a possible icehouse
  branch

Change-Id: Iefb4f254e14e977333c23817d157c0995c002c6b

Added support for the connector's multipath boolean.  If this is
set the initialize_connection function returns arrays of all the
IQNs, LUNs and portals associated with the mapping of the volume

IQN, LUN and portal is implemented.

Minor change to find_volume.  If a volume name or instance is is
not set then it will not be sent as a filter to the storage back
end array.

Additional Unit Tests to support the changes.

commit_message:
Dell sc driver iscsi multipath enhancement

Added support for the connector's multipath boolean.  If this is
set the initialize_connection function returns arrays of all the
IQNs, LUNs and portals associated with the mapping of the volume
to the server.  If this is not set the standard return of a lone
IQN, LUN and portal is implemented.

Minor change to find_volume.  If a volume name or instance isn't
set then it will not be sent as a payload filter to the Dell
Storage Center array.

Additional Unit Tests to support the changes.

Change-Id: I2f7404c76c71f5bf6d06496ab5aa4617ba80615b
Implements: blueprint dell-sc-driver-iscsi-multipath-enhancement

commit_message:
Adds positive container functional tests

Adds several positive tests for generic and RSA containers.
There are no negative tests added in this set.
There were changes made to the behaviors to accomidate changing
the secrets dictionary from the default data set.

Change-Id: I4062ed9514d53741dabb4426a603e506b88e1a6c

commit_message:
Change template for bridges created by libvirt

Change prefix for linux bridges names which are
created by libvrirt driver for new environments.
This allows to use 2.5.x and 2.9.x versions of
fuel-devops on single server.

Change-Id: I940bb3e70b3e138dc4b55e6bd37554da5b073073
Closes-bug: #1422687

commit_message:
Adds support for user created f5 prefix names and route domains

Added the ability for the user of the f5 config script to override
the default prefix of RPC. This is needed when multiple labs are
running on the same f5.

Added the ability for the user of the f5 config script to use route
domains on their f5. This is used for multiple labs using the same
f5 LB

Change-Id: I0eba42cf3cb2419818d31c9ad2593a529fc375dc
Closes-Bug: #1415994
(cherry picked from commit d2e1d41cb8bcb3355899f50c970381ddc20f11cd)

subject: Exclude vxlan from physical interface mapping in ml2_conf.ini
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2556, 'name': 'Evan Callicoat', 'email': 'apsu@propter.net', 'username': 'diopter'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 9884, 'name': 'Wherenow.org CI', 'email': 'jenkins@wherenow.org', 'username': 'wherenowjenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-09 19:57:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "This PR removes the vxlan physical interface mappings in the
ml2_conf.ini, which is not needed (Please double check me on this)
It could also cause problems with starting neutron when running RPC on a
consolidated architecture i.e. running all traffic over br-mgmt, in
which case the mappings would be vxlan:br-mgmt,vlan:br-mgmt. The neutron
agent would then throw an error like:

ERROR neutron.plugins.linuxbridge.agent.linuxbridge_neutron_agent [-]
Parsing physical_interface_mappings failed: Value br-mgmt in mapping:
'vxlan:br-mgmt' not unique. Agent terminated!

-Alex

Change-Id: I87fce0845140f1c38404fd57ff601f55b3d1c503
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-12-10 14:54:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Exclude vxlan from physical interface mapping in ml2_conf.ini

This commit removes the vxlan physical interface mappings in the
ml2_conf.ini, which is not needed (Please double check me on this)
It could also cause problems with starting neutron when running RPC on a
consolidated architecture i.e. running all traffic over br-mgmt, in
which case the mappings would be vxlan:br-mgmt,vlan:br-mgmt. The neutron
agent would then throw an error like:

commit_message:
Exclude vxlan from physical interface mapping in ml2_conf.ini

This commit removes the vxlan physical interface mappings in the
ml2_conf.ini, which is not needed (Please double check me on this)
It could also cause problems with starting neutron when running RPC on a
consolidated architecture i.e. running all traffic over br-mgmt, in
which case the mappings would be vxlan:br-mgmt,vlan:br-mgmt. The neutron
agent would then throw an error like:
ERROR neutron.plugins.linuxbridge.agent.linuxbridge_neutron_agent [-]
Parsing physical_interface_mappings failed: Value br-mgmt in mapping:
'vxlan:br-mgmt' not unique. Agent terminated!

Closes-Bug: #1401135
Change-Id: I87fce0845140f1c38404fd57ff601f55b3d1c503

subject: Remove ImportError handling in dynamic_inventory
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-17 15:47:17.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/inventory/dynamic_inventory.py'], 'message': 'Remove ImportError handling in dynamic_inventory

The import of netaddr any yaml is done within a try/except block. If an
ImportError occurs an error message is printed and the script ignores
it. Ansible does not display the printed message and the script will
still fail, just later on.

This commit removes the exception handling so that if there is an
ImportError the script will fail straight away.

Change-Id: Iff935db62bde954ac4ff0b920409c18dd494bdff
Closes-Bug: #1420312
(cherry picked from commit de32ddca574150806c4dbb9a47930b0b6d1196f0)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove ImportError handling in dynamic_inventory

The import of netaddr any yaml is done within a try/except block. If an
ImportError occurs an error message is printed and the script ignores
it. Ansible does not display the printed message and the script will
still fail, just later on.

This commit removes the exception handling so that if there is an
ImportError the script will fail straight away.

Change-Id: Iff935db62bde954ac4ff0b920409c18dd494bdff
Closes-Bug: #1420312
(cherry picked from commit de32ddca574150806c4dbb9a47930b0b6d1196f0)

commit_message:
Add retry and fallback server capability to apt-key tasks

This patch adds retries (with a delay) to the common and
container_common apt-key tasks, then also includes an optional retry
using a fallback keyserver for the appropriate tasks.

The patch also removes the conditional for the platform version as it is
not entirely relevant at this stage - the whole environment is only
tested to work on Ubuntu 14.04 anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1423123
Change-Id: Ica590a61319f60beaa8c6d6f4b8210400efca922

Update neutron for pypowervm schema_version update

Recent updates to pypowervm require the schema type to be set.  Updated
the backing mock objects to support this.  Enables tox for py27 to pass.

This patch implements the capability to pin package versions using apt

doing general packages deployment and maintenance.

The list of packages and versions can be overridden using user
variables.

For each item in 'apt_pinned_packages'
 - package: package name
 - version: package version to pin
 - priority: pin priority (default is 900, over 1000 will make apt force
   a downgrade)

The patch also removes the usage of the LXC PPA - it was only deployed
if the operating system was < 14.04 and the reality is that the entire
project has not been tested on a platform < 14.04. The removal of the
PPA is thus to reduce confusion.

It also includes a known set of packages which are important to pin for
a stable OpenStack deployment. The packages pinned use sources and
version which should be available for a typical 'Long Term Support'
time-frame.

Closes-Bug: #1412898

commit_message:
Allow the pinning of apt package versions

This patch implements the capability to pin package versions using apt
preferences. This prevents the unwitting upgrading of packages when
doing general packages deployment and maintenance.

The list of packages and versions can be overridden using user
variables.

For each item in 'apt_pinned_packages'
 - package: package name
 - version: package version to pin
 - priority: pin priority (default is 900, over 1000 will make apt force
   a downgrade)

The patch also removes the usage of the LXC PPA - it was only deployed
if the operating system was < 14.04 and the reality is that the entire
project has not been tested on a platform < 14.04. The removal of the
PPA is thus to reduce confusion.

It also includes a known set of packages which are important to pin for
a stable OpenStack deployment. The packages pinned use sources and
version which should be available for a typical 'Long Term Support'
time-frame.

Closes-Bug: #1412898
Change-Id: I747e233a2c2d7e2c30e4d653cbeaca2e3cbe249a
(cherry picked from commit f2ef204f97f0811c23169baf131546699b7a1a1b)

commit_message:
Pin rabbitmq package version

This patch implements a pinned RabbitMQ package version which is
downloaded (by default) from the official RabbitMQ package download
location.

The user has the ability to use the following variables in order to
override where the package downloads from and what version is
downloaded:
 - rabbitmq_version: the package version
 - rabbitmq_repo_url: the base url to download from
 - rabbitmq_package_url: the full url including the base, the path and
   the package file name

Conflicts:
        rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/rabbit.yml
        rpc_deployment/roles/rabbit_common/tasks/main.yml

Partial-Bug: #1412898
Change-Id: I206daf4df18aa90d975f979a656de60a06e7c8f3
(cherry picked from commit 7fcf6026b783ca079c760d3ac6ce29fbfcc8d6ad)

commit_message:
Store all package repo URLs in variables

This change stores the URL of each package repo in a variable
to allow for them to be overridable through user configuration.

Change-Id: I2e25029dab4969181a4481af68ed802414e8d5c1
Closes-Bug: 1414880
(cherry picked from commit c7f37d6efc570071e4733035a573b464e6b0d3b3)

commit_message:
Remove deprecated openstack::swift::notify::ceilometer class

openstack::swift::notify::ceilometer no longer exist and ceilometer
configuration has been moved into openstack::swift::proxy class.
See Idbfa7db5b5debdf5fe4ead33125284178971bc8f for details.

Change-Id: I921767214555f36651149490b09a45e64ef5f340
Closes-bug: #1423544

commit_message:
Update mtms_str to invoke as property

Base pypowervm API changed the mtms_str from a method to property.  This
broke boot up of the compute agent.  This updates the agent to use the
property.

Change-Id: I03670285ba6c9c01628e924de393c07a801d46f4

commit_message:
Assume a new developer won't create a "desinate" user in the dev guide

The getting started docs suggest checking the code out into `/var/lib`,
but this requires a later step of adding a `designate` user to the
sudoers list without adding a step of adding the `designate` user in the
first place.

This updates the docs and basic config example to simply check out the
code into `$HOME/openstack/designate/` and removes sudoers step.

Closes-Bug: 1423628
Change-Id: I0a30e308aec428f4615c55de6b7c3a5f4292f7b1

commit_message:
exclude functional tests from unit test runs

Unit tests should not run any of the functional tests. The functional
tests should be explicitly run by the user.

The `keystone_excludes` references can be removed once all of the
existing tests have been split into either the functional or unit test
directories. I am choosing not to do the split now so that we have
time to evaluate and maybe rewrite (if necessary) before the move. We
are starting to write functional tests and need to be able to run them
before all of that work is complete.

bp functional-tests

Change-Id: Ic181404b9bbb926cf3fe23f245f5252796542f56

commit_message:
Tempest changes

This change does the following:

* updates neutron ansible library to support adding networks, subnets,
  routers, etc.
* updates tempest_resources to create network/subnet/router,
  tempest-specific flavors, and swift reseller role
* updates tempest.conf to disable neutron features which don't work in
  our environment and other minor changes
* updates tempest.conf to enable swift tests depending on whether
  tempest_swift_enabled is set (we also create
  inventory/group_vars/tempest_all.yml defaulting this to true)

Conflicts:
        rpc_deployment/library/neutron

Change-Id: I607ec6556d792573f1f56ab1d29bbcf97b1f39ce
(cherry picked from commit 6f3496bae518a6f8bf13b70404e6f2da48e609b7)

location and therefore creating remote images. Tempest users need this
functionality, so this patch adds a role to those users and a policy to
allow that role to set image location.

The change that allows users to specify roles to be added to tempest

commit_message:
Add role for tempest to allow set image location

Recent glance policy additions prevent non admins from setting image
location and therefore creating remote images. Tempest users need this
functionality, so this patch adds a role to those users and a policy to
allow that role to set image location.

The change that allows users to specify roles to be added to tempest
users has already been merged upstream:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/147542/

In order to use the upstream tempest changes, I had to bump the tempest
sha, which in turn required some client package upgrades:

 * tempest to 3feb4d4e1f9367269a226f788ff468f820751340
 * python-glanceclient to 0.15.0
 * python-saharaclient to 0.7.6

Conflicts:
        rpc_deployment/library/neutron
        rpc_deployment/roles/tempest_resources/tasks/main.yml
        rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/python_glanceclient.yml
        rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/python_saharaclient.yml
        rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/tempest.yml

Change-Id: I9ed053bf70680db54b1cf679a171d61ea639f19d
Closes-Bug: #1411599
(cherry picked from commit a5ab931267c613d4cf802a1c0158bc602b99fd84)

commit_message:
Use mock from standard library in py3x env

There is no possibility to use mock library from pypi with python 3.4
because of bug [1], so there is a sense to use unittest.mock  with py3x.

Added mock to six.moves, imports fixed.

[1] https://code.google.com/p/mock/issues/detail?id=234

Change-Id: I1c7d438892ba494f54451084ef0b68da091f18ab

commit_message:
Updates ref arch schemes for OVS+GRE, OVS+VLAN

The following schemes should be updated as follows:
* OVS+GRE - add legend, add description for GRE,
create physical connection scheme
* OVS+VLAN - add legend, create physical connection scheme

Change-Id: Ie7c6e9a0871dd611b410ae8fb1e925d09d2334ff
Closes-Bug: 1415904

commit_message:
Use oslo_utils replace oslo.utils

oslo.utils 1.2.0 has changed its namespace from oslo.utils to
oslo_utils.

Co-Authored-By: Victor Sergeyev <vsergeyev@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I07ce4791cfe3b32efb02be60f792bd1c4f03d82f

commit_message:
Moves create region from controller to manager

This logic was originally added in 8ea1b14, but really doesn't belong at
the controller layer as it isn't related to handling a web request.

Change-Id: I6ae92633f0fbbc5acfa7c6efd1b23f9a703423a6

commit_message:
Add AB testing code to docs.mirantis.com layout

The marketing team needs to be able to do AB testing on
docs.mirantis.com.

This commit places an AB testing js code in the doc layout
right after the </title> tag on all the pages at docs.mirantis.com.

Closes-Bug: 1328069

Change-Id: Id9c2fad02db7e77ddda8684ef3cfe21211feb270

commit_message:
Update TLS config recommendations

Session tickets are tricky business. Using them correctly requires some
additional thinking and tooling. This updates our suggested configs
for Apache and Nginx to disable session tickets. And this also provides
a mention of the issue for people to be aware of the situation.

Change-Id: I70fe086a97d5c2db74c85b1b0fe16bf65b0339c4
Closes-Bug: 1418661

commit_message:
Removes unnecessary checks when cleaning a domain

When an internal notification for cleaning up a
domain was sent, the callback method was checking
the domain_id from users and groups, which is
unnecessary since they were filtered by that
value.

Closes-Bug: #1409211

Change-Id: I151e8c7af885a9b3681b08bc47de443910a753bb

commit_message:
fake: fix public API signatures to match virt driver

The fake driver had a number of places where it did not
correctly follow the API signature of the virt driver.
Fix them, and add a test to validate it.

Change-Id: I7b0b3855a0dd291a71ccfc9e5afb0235ed7536f0

commit_message:
Update vCenter hypervisor screenshot in wizard

In Fuel 6.0, vCenter settings can take not only IP address,
but also Hostname in the corresponding field.

Two screenshots are updated:

* for wizard (hv)
* for Fuel web UI (Settings tab)

Change-Id: Id798e862871ba5876c0191cfdb9b1a1479531608
Closes-Bug: 1401169

commit_message:
Namespace PYPI_MIRROR_URL vars with DIB

We have a good pattern of namespacing env vars with DIB_. Add support
for DIB_PYPI_MIRROR_URL* and maintain backwards compat support.

Change-Id: I434c9d1b14cd571b20754c9ad7cd64c936f8399a

commit_message:
Allow setting OS_DEBUG_LOGGING

In t-i-e I37d8391a4984f2c34368724212c81d10dbab2dee we start supporting
an env variable OS_DEUBUG_LOGGING which controls whether we set debug
logs at build time. If -d is passed to devtest* we should be setting
this.

Change-Id: I3bb21a289d2c0d65ff1eb6865e70f2d9b554f7fb

commit_message:
Fix data leakage in multiple object versions

When two or more containers were set to send object
versions to the same destination container and both
had versioned files with the same name each retrieved
the newest version possibly getting data from the
other one. Now versions carry information from their
source container.

Change-Id: I445a4e8584b431dedc204b8b1acc9af13b401329
Closes-Bug: #1138531

commit_message:
Build wheel cache for venvs

Building a bunch of virtual envs later is going to be tedious if we do not
pre-cache certain annoying-to-build packages.

* tools/build_wheels.sh: pre-build some wheels for annoying package installs
* list distro package dependencies in files/*/venv
* list packages to pre-build as wheels in files/venv-requirements.txt
* install database Python modules when setting up the database

Change-Id: Idff1ea69a5ca12ba56098e664dbf6924fe6a2e47

commit_message:
Separate TOSCA capabilities definition from assignment

With introduction of new TOSCA capabilities like OperatingSystem, Scalability
etc., TOSCA capabilites are now more mature and complex. This separation
provides cleaner approach.

Partially Implements: blueprint tosca-compute-os-capability

Change-Id: I9af208741f01eb9ebc74c41b10d0a7bfda9d2e5d

commit_message:
Work correctly if hmac.compare_digest isn't available

The hmac.compare_digest function provides nice constant time
functionality but unfortunately isn't available in python
versions < 2.7.7

Change-Id: I59509249256e32efcd994dbdc703c9c10ea9a4ea

commit_message:
Update HTTPS certificate handling for pep-0476

This pep (included in python 2.7.9) changes the behaviour of SSL
certificate chain handling to be more py3 like.

Include required new exception behaviour in the list of
exceptions to translate under py2.

https://github.com/python/peps/blob/master/pep-0476.txt

Closes-Bug: 1404227

Change-Id: I7da1a13d1ec861a07fd96684d0431508a214a2c8

commit_message:
L2gateway CLI Enhancement

L2gateway create command is enhanced to create l2gateway with
devices having multiple interfaces and segmentation id.
Some other changes are also made to syn it with rest-apis
in spec.

Change-Id: Ia5175f8887353de906c7abcbfa44dd7d0c65e72b

commit_message:
Properly handle policy values containing spaces

Add quotes around the ${value} for the augeas resources, which
will properly handle values that contain spaces.  Otherwise,
the value gets truncated at the first space.

Change-Id: I24ee5312a0e492e264b38756649654b9d5930f4c
Closes-bug: 1416523

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-19 11:21:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[PostgreSQL] Fix regexp operator

Add different operators relative to dialect.
It's needed to support same regexp format for all backends.
Other way to support regexp operator in sqlalchemy is using a
"LIKE" operator instead "regexp" or "~".

Closes-bug: 1423171
Change-Id: I0e732358cff754ae9407ba6b1932bcbe1b1ce1b9
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-02-19 12:58:50.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/utils.py', 'ceilometer/alarm/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': "[PostgreSQL] Fix regexp operator

Add different operators relative to dialect.
It's needed to support same regexp format for all backends.

Closes-bug: 1423171
Change-Id: I0e732358cff754ae9407ba6b1932bcbe1b1ce1b9", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
[PostgreSQL] Fix regexp operator

Add different operators relative to dialect.
It's needed to support same regexp format for all backends.

Closes-bug: 1423171
Change-Id: I0e732358cff754ae9407ba6b1932bcbe1b1ce1b9

commit_message:
Set a higher default for maxDiff

testtools.TestCase.maxDiff is the number of characters
shown when two objects do not match for assertDictEqual,
assertMultiLineEqual, and assertSequenceEqual. The
default is 640 which is too low for comparing most dicts.

Change-Id: I1cb7b12b1a7491637b695abe76207b6db8a65fb5

commit_message:
Avoid deregistering conductor following SIGUSR1

Allow the conductor to avoid deregistering itself on shutdown, after
receiving a SIGUSR1 signal. The registration will time out after a
period defined by the conductor.heartbeat_timeout configuration setting
(defaults to 60 seconds). If the conductor is restarted within this
period, the unnecessary thrash caused by two ring rebalances will be
avoided. This is useful in situations where the downtime is negligible,
such as an upgrade.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1418474
Change-Id: Ie40a7f878c2845dc9cb8fc8082df5d88adb28d0b

commit_message:
Revert "Remove RPC dependency to create FIP agent gw port"

This reverts commit 9c9db24738161aef465489b320e6f54a94b4cac7.

This commit broke tripleo-ci, with reports of a missing L3
agent on a compute node.

Change-Id: I0360f33100363200379f3880427a919e1ec579aa
Closes-Bug: #1423228

subject: Change SNMP 'hardware.memory.used' metric to reflect (memTotalReal - memAvailReal) which is the used value for the memory for a physical machine. This has to be done as SNMP does not provide a memory metric for used that can be directly used.

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Change SNMP 'hardware.memory.used' metric to reflect (memTotalReal - memAvailReal) which is the used value for the memory for a physical machine.
This has to be done as SNMP does not provide a memory metric for used that can be directly used.

Change-Id: I3c2be2dee65c278d99144ebf1cd8b0db1adfff6d

commit_message:
Add clean_exit for py-pgsql unit tests

Currently, py-pgsql env doesn't stop postgresql daemon if
tests fails. In this patchset clean_exit function for postgresql
have been added.

Change-Id: If93d261108b2536ce92e15598a56d6cd8267b1fd
Closes-bug: 1423524

subject: Further decorator changes and plugin migration
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-19 04:19:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Further decorator changes and plugin migration

Continuing to deliver the refactor discussed during the OSSG mid-cycle.

This change completes the definition of new decorators to be applied
at the plugin/test level.  It also migrates existing tests over to use
one of the new decorators, using checks() instead of the checks_*()
functions.

With the checks_*() decorators we had tried to abstract away from the
AST nodes.  That was overly-complicating the framework, and there's
value to be had from understanding the AST, so we're removing that
abstraction.

Tests will now be able to use the checks() decorator and include the
AST nodes they can be executed against.  For example:

@checks('Import', 'ImportFrom')
def random_lib_imports(context):
[..]

@checks('Call')
def ssl_with_bad_version(context, config):
[..]

This change also cleans up the definition of additional new decorators
(severity(), confidence(), category(), title(), uuid()) which future
commits will build out the framework further to utilize.

Change-Id: I32017d21ed897b087ddfc249ebb5b604a9a832fa

commit_message:
Further decorator changes and plugin migration

Continuing to deliver the refactor discussed during the OSSG mid-cycle.

This change completes the definition of new decorators to be applied
at the plugin/test level.  It also migrates existing tests over to use
one of the new decorators, using checks() instead of the checks_*()
functions.

With the checks_*() decorators we had tried to abstract away from the
AST nodes.  That was overly-complicating the framework, and there's
value to be had from understanding the AST, so we're removing that
abstraction.

Tests will now be able to use the checks() decorator and include the
AST nodes they can be executed against.  For example:

@checks('Import', 'ImportFrom')
def random_lib_imports(context):
[..]

@checks('Call')
def ssl_with_bad_version(context, config):
[..]

This change also cleans up the definition of additional new decorators
(severity(), category(), title(), uuid()) which future commits will build
out the framework further to utilize.

Change-Id: I32017d21ed897b087ddfc249ebb5b604a9a832fa

commit_message:
Utilize polling_interval conf option

The polling_interval CONF option in the agent configuration was not
being utilize.  Instead it had been hardcoded.  This should be utilized
so that administrators have configurability in their polling.

Change-Id: Ib92c6693c820435e7c947140f2f63540d1564eac
Closes-Bug: #1423259

commit_message:

Previously, the rabbit container was configured for use in
a k8s cluster. This patch updates the container to run with fig
instead of k8s.

subject: Disentangle tarring in logfiles and increase logging
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-24 11:16:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Disentangle tarring if logfiles for simplicity

We're having problems with some part of creating this tarfile; but
trying to create the tarfile and move it across the network all in one
step is making it difficult to figure out what's going wrong.

This change is intended to be slower and more methodical. Instead of
doing this all at once, we use several SSH commands to create a tempdir;
then to create a tarfile inside it; then to scp that file onto our
working machine; then to unpack it.

This will probably be slower, but should give us more information about
how each step is proceeding - which should in turn enable us to figure
out what's breaking and what we can do about it.

Change-Id: I867869bb516ea70312eaf5f00ec071ad652c44e8
Partial-bug: 1414098

commit_message:
Disentangle tarring in logfiles and increase logging

We're having problems with some part of creating this tarfile; but
trying to create the tarfile and move it across the network all in one
step is making it difficult to figure out what's going wrong.

This change is intended to be slower and more methodical. Instead of
doing this all at once, we use several SSH commands to create a tempdir;
then to create a tarfile inside it; then to scp that file onto our
working machine; then to unpack it.

This will probably be slower, but should give us more information about
how each step is proceeding - which should in turn enable us to figure
out what's breaking and what we can do about it.

Also increasing our ssh log level to Verbose so we see relevant error
messages when our ssh/scp commands fail.

Change-Id: I867869bb516ea70312eaf5f00ec071ad652c44e8
Partial-bug: 1414098

commit_message:
For flake8 check, make the 'E12' ignore be more granular

ignore = E12 means ignore E12* errors.

Make it more granular by converting to E121,E122,...,E129

This will make it easier in the future to remove a single ignore and
update the code to resolve the issues.

Change-Id: Iddff6a826bc7c9ff07643b7408c51f1bd129530c

commit_message:
Don't assume contents of values after aggregate_update

aggregate_update() was explicitly setting values['metadata'] for the
caller. However, it has also popped availability_zone, which it
doesn't replace. Also, other _update() functions in the db api don't
do this after modifying values in place, so anything which assumed
this behaviour would be inconsistent.

The only code which did assume this behaviour was in a test. This
patch fixes the test.

Change-Id: Iaa21576655da037e6186e900234e2c29c9e3a652
